I‚Äôve seen this formula almost exactly, so it‚Äôs hard to be too invested, but it‚Äôs well-made, well-acted, and horny as hell so I‚Äôm on board *** SPOILERS *** * younger Mickey Rourke always shocks me * a clown driving a convertible? An inauspicious sign * William Hurt looks bored even when he‚Äôs killing a guy * ‚ÄúTap dancing Ted Danson!‚Äù should be a swear * Kathleen Turner walking into the dark, great shot

Name: Crimes of Passion
Review:
Kathleen Turner plays a dual life as a fashion designer and a sex worker, taking quaaludes and drinking J&B, looking for freedom or whatever

Anthony Perkins is a weirdo street preacher dishing out his violent form of personal salvation. There‚Äôs a world where he and Jeffrey Combs play psychotic brothers

Annie Potts plays the sexually repressed wife who lost her spark trying to keep the family together. Her character breaks my heart, she wants to figure out her marriage, but her husband ‚Äî like all the other wackos ‚Äî is obsessing over China Blue

John Laughlin is the husband who just wants to f u c k. A sock puppet could replace him, he‚Äôs doing nothing

This script is so goofy when it‚Äôs Kathleen Turner and Anthony Perkins ‚Äî so many scenes are nothing but double entendres between sex and religion ‚Äî and so melodramatic when it‚Äôs Annie Potts and John Laughlin

It wins some weird points, but this isn‚Äôt a great movie. I know there are at least five other versions of this on the cutting room floor, and maybe one of those is better

* Rick Wakeman?? I guess he did the soundtrack, but still weird seeing his face in a movie
* My friends cheering me on as I play a character named the Human Penis
* That Life Savers wrapping paper rules

Name: Evil Dead II
Review:
I went to Bruce-O-Rama with Bruce Campbell at Carolina Theater. There was a game show that Bruce hosted called Last Fan Standing before the movie, and it was entertaining, but the nerds in the audience were so vocally angry when someone onstage didn‚Äôt know their favorite IP

Just before the movie was a quick Q&A, and I should‚Äôve known what was to come based on the range of questions, from hyper-specific questions that Campbell could only answer with, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, I didn‚Äôt write the thing‚Äù to ‚Äúdesperate for laughs‚Äù questions like ‚Äúis mayonnaise considered a musical instrument?‚Äù (Not kidding)

I haven‚Äôt seen this movie since high school, and I was eager to give it a reevaluation as someone who has come to love horror more than my younger self. The wrong venue for that, I guess

If you ever have the chance to watch Evil Dead 2 with an auditorium of Bruce Campbell fans, don‚Äôt. A miserable experience of nerds trying to out-riff each other over every second of the movie. I gave it as long as I could manage, but I couldn‚Äôt sit through the movie with this audience

Next time I‚Äôll try the Alamo or some venue where people like watching movies

Name: Jade
Review:
I remember my dad renting this movie when it came out around the time of my parent‚Äôs divorce. When I picked it up and looked at it, he told me a friend recommended it and that it was terrible. I didn‚Äôt believe him until now

It‚Äôs so funny how inept this movie is. The dialog is goofy as hell; it‚Äôs like a middle schooler trying to sound tough. The camera doesn‚Äôt know what to do with the sex and nudity; it observes like a cop on a crime scene: detached and a little disgusted

There are some incredible car stunts, and almost all are unintentionally funny. So many cars fly over San Francisco hills, a la Crazy Taxi!

I can track along with the plot until the last 20 minutes‚Ä¶ admittedly, a very giallo move to twist into nonsense

This is Friedkin‚Äôs favorite movie that he made‚Ä¶ I guess he was too close to it, couldn‚Äôt see what he missed, and assumed it was there

This movie is so bad. I love it

* The blood looks glossy; I kind of dig it
* Everyone says ‚Äúgod-damn it‚Äù constantly, and no one sounds natural saying it¬†
* ‚ÄúCristal, Beluga, Wolfgang Puck‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a fuck-house,‚Äù sighs David Caruso as he digs through a crime scene mini-fridge

Name: Poison Ivy
Review:
Drew Barrymore is doing the perfunctory ‚Äúadult‚Äù movie that child actors do to prove that they‚Äôre ‚Äúnot a kid anymore‚Äù or something

Jennifer‚Äôs Body-type relationship between Drew Barrymore and Sara Gilbert ‚Äî the dangerous object of desire and the observer

It sucks when you bond with another outsider only for them to try and fuck your dad ‚Äî or, more specifically, try to replace your mom

I think there‚Äôs something genuine at the core of this movie ‚Äî the mother-daughter relationship has specifics and color that the rest of the movie lacks. Drew Barrymore‚Äôs character could have a more nuanced take with a different actor
Tags: criterion channel, erotic thrillers, coming-of-age, written by women, directed by women

Name: Grandma's Boy
Review: Hollis insisted we get high and watch this, so we did. Neat!

Name: Yes, Madam!
Review:
Michelle Yeoh is cool as hell and uncanny in her ability to be at the right place at the right time.¬†

Tsui Hark has excellent comedic timing

It‚Äôs a bummer that the two women leads have to be adversaries. There‚Äôs plenty of conflict going on without the ‚Äúwomen can‚Äôt work together‚Äù trope, but thankfully it doesn‚Äôt last too long

I wish they cut less during the fights. Everyone can clearly do the moves, so it just feels disjointed

Still, great stunts ‚Äî and some really dangerous stuff with real glass that Hong Kong was doing at the time ‚Äî lots of dudes flying, a lot of fun

Name: Rye Lane
Review:
Wow, this movie won me over so quickly

Vivian Oparah Is instantly charming ‚Äî David Jonsson does neurotic without making it hammy

Great use of color and cinematic storytelling ‚Äî Raine Allen-Miller takes the Before¬†trilogy‚Äôs day-in-a-life structure and injects their perspective and sharp comedic timing

And I always love seeing London onscreen ‚Äî I get the feeling I‚Äôm getting Miller‚Äôs tour of their neighborhood. The world is so lived-in and expresses so much personality in such a short time

It loses some momentum in the third act, where it falls into some clich√©s, but nothing offensive

A new rom-com classic

Name: Suzume
Review:
A movie of beautiful images and sweeping music tied loosely together with a meandering story and no fundamental themes. Like, I made up one about memories linking us to the earth and our loved ones giving us a reason to live, but that‚Äôs not present in the text

If you cut a couple of characters and ~30 minutes and made one change the direction the movie took, you‚Äôd have something pretty great. But what we get is pretty muddy, almost like they had the pictures first and had to make them all fit together

Also, penis clouds. Like, veins in their heads, growing, plopping down on the ground penis clouds. What the fuck?

Despite all of that, I found enough in the movie to enjoy, and I‚Äôm still curious to check out Your Name

Name: Thelma & Louise
Review: Felt like it was time to watch Ridley Scott‚Äôs magnum opus ‚Äî and Hans Zimmer‚Äôs most well-renowned score after Cool Runnings. Right off the bat, I needed subtitles to understand Susan Sarandon's accent choice. Geena Davis is perfect as always, no notes ‚Äî bringing a gun on a road trip for ‚Äúpsycho killers, bears, or snakes.‚Äù They‚Äôre both great, honestly. They give incredible performances of two traumatized people trying to cope with worsening circumstances. ‚ÄúEvery time we get in trouble, you plead insanity or some shit.‚Äù What kind of trouble are they getting into before this?? Christopher McDonald was clearly the influence for Kenny Powers, hair and mustache-wise. Brad Pitt!? Geena Davis panting like a dog over his cute butt, is hysterical. Charming as hell, I don‚Äôt blame her. I love the dude outside the gas station beasting out bicep curls. The police are remarkably competent in this movie, but I guess they have to be for this plot to work. The night lighting is so good, it‚Äôs exaggerated, but it really works. Of course, one of the most iconic endings of all time. Ebert wanted to see their charred corpses at the bottom of the Grand Canyon. What a buffoon. You know, I was kind of facetious earlier about this being Ridley Scott‚Äôs best, but the only movie of his I like more is Alien. I‚Äôd much rather he make stuff like this instead of the shit he‚Äôs been churning out for the past 20 years. But the music sucks.

Name: Eyes of Fire
Review:
I like a lot about this movie: the land just absorbing these people, the blas√© cult leader, faces in the trees, blood in the soil‚Ä¶

But it wasn‚Äôt well-acted, and the ending kind of goes off the deep end and not in an exciting way

The special effects are bad, but they‚Äôre pretty fun sometimes, but again, they go overboard, and it kind of becomes a mess

Still, good, bad vibes
Tags: shudder, folk horror: a study, Redsploitation

Name: Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves
Review:
I laughed, Chris Pine charmed my little pants off, the movie MacGuffin‚Äôd the ever-living shit out of me, and in true D&D fashion, it ripped off as many movie tropes as it could

It‚Äôs too long, man. They had too many things to put in there for fans, and it probably made it more successful, but it also made it a slog
Tags: anna, owen, amc southpoint, Sword & Sorcery

Name: Witchfinder General
Review:
Letterboxd keeps erasing my reviews when I set them aside mid-movie, so my reviews have been shit lately.¬†

Vincent Price has the power of a witch hunter, who can claim anyone as a witch for the right price, and who takes what he wants without repercussion¬†

When Price has his way with the wife of Ian Ogilvy ‚Äî who I would describe as a hotter Anthony Hopkins ‚Äî Ogilvy seeks revenge, tracking down Price and his lackey, even when abandoning his military post may cost him his life

The movie takes the classic revenge horror shape ‚Äî the first half dedicated to character development and the horrific acts that motivate the revenge, the second half, the revenge ‚Äî but gives it more of a historical drama feel than outright exploitation (I say that, but the movie was considered quite exploitative in its time)

Price feels unstoppable, having the side of all of the ‚Äúgood Christians‚Äù who will come to his defense, whether that be godly devotion or fear of reproach

The movie also plays on the morality of the hero, having him in military service to Oliver Cromwell, whose campaign against the Irish was unforgiving, not unlike witch hunting. Everyone serves someone, and no one is guiltless

The movie is an excellent example of a film using its runtime wisely ‚Äî it manages to be under 90 minutes and not feel economical or stripped of character moments

Whenever anyone talks about ‚Äúelevated horror‚Äù as a new thing, point them to this ‚Äî films like The VVITCH fall into the legacy of ‚Äúfolk horror‚Äù that this movie helped kick-off
Tags: shudder, folk horror: a study, britsploitation

Name: A Silent Voice: The Movie
Review:
Teenage melodrama slice of life, where love and friendship are quite literally life or death

There are always going to be anime tropes and stylistic choices that keep me from loving it, but this stays grounded in the way it portrays bullying and the relationship between regret and isolation

A sentimental and cozy Sunday watch

Name: The Adventures of Prince Achmed
Review:
Lotte Reiniger pioneered the earliest silhouette animations, this being the earliest surviving one from 1926

Insanely beautiful and intricate animation, with excellent character design and fluid motion that sometimes feels human. Story-wise, it's all familiar territory

Maybe I‚Äôve seen one other silhouette animation film, and it was in school or on PBS?

It doesn‚Äôt seem intentional, but there‚Äôs a scene where the magician on Magic Mountain summons a bow from below the screen, and the cells slip and become visible, giving a sort of meta feel, as though he summoned it from outside the film itself

Name: The Mitchells vs. the Machines
Review:
A Goofy Movie¬†meets M3GAN¬†meets Be Kind Rewind¬†??

This movie was clearly made for parents my age, including the Scott Pilgrim-esque¬†visual effect flourishes, the lol so random, and /r/totallynotrobots humor

So you know, it totally worked on me. I‚Äôm embarrassed at how much I laughed at the Furby subtitles

One of the more visually creative mainstream animated movies in recent years. A low bar, but still

Name: Princess Mononoke
Review:
A god-turned-demon attacks a tribe, staining a boy with its hatred. Seeking a cure, he seeks the spirit of the forest. In the process, he meets the town destroying the forest and creating these demons. But it isn‚Äôt as simple as all that, as prejudices and wounds blind both sides

Though the forest and humanity fight one another, the boy seeks a third path where the two can live in harmony. To persuade them, he must walk through wars and as a last resort, join them

The violence is way more intense than I thought it would be. I knew there was blood, but arms and heads fly

The pacing is pretty perfect, not giving up too much time for the battle scenes and making plenty of room for the awe of nature that lives in so many Miyazaki movies

Not one of my favorites of Miyazaki ‚Äî I prefer the stuff without fighting ‚Äî but it‚Äôs a beautiful and somewhat nuanced movie about coexistence, something the Avatars of the world could stand to learn

Name: Gremlins
Review:
Seeing Phoebe Cates and Judge Reinhold, I have to assume this movie is in the Fast Times at Ridgemont High extended universe

This is why furbies freak people out. They look like uncanny valley mogwai. Similarly, baby Yoda is too far in the other direction for me ‚Äî too cute, with no personality

The second there was more than one mogwai, I was so stressed out üò∞¬†

Just top-notch puppetry work and design, Chris Walas is brilliant

I didn‚Äôt know this was a Christmas or a terrible dad inventor movie. They keep shooting ‚Äútoothpaste‚Äù all over the dad, and it‚Äôs‚Ä¶ weird. My favorite invention of his is the hammer with a trillion batteries attached to it

I love how gross the mogwai transformation is‚Ä¶ they seem to change from mammal to reptile?¬†

Mom‚Äôs a total badass. She destroys those dudes with zero hesitation

Once the transformed mogwai falls into the pool ‚Äî near the halfway point ‚Äî the movie ultimately falls apart. As a kid's movie, it probably holds attention, but I begged for it to be over

Appreciate the craftsmanship on display and some of the performances, but the story is not for me

Name: The Blood on Satan's Claw
Review:
Well, this certainly paints witchcraft in a negative light. It gets all muddled up with Satan worship, with the floral crowns and whatnot giving it all a pagan feel

Mysterious occurrences as people discover a strange corpse that disappears, and the claws of that corpse that compels the children to perform dark rituals on one another, practices that culminate in rape and murder

A man‚Äôs fianc√© goes mad, but as the asylum takes her away, her hand appears as one with the same claws. Perhaps that ‚Äúcorpse‚Äù was not one after all?

When a family discovers their daughter has a patch of fur on her ‚Äî the devil‚Äôs skin ‚Äî the witch hunt begins

I like the idea of satanism being a disease that affects the body and compels you to worship Satan

The soundtrack oscillates between foreboding and whimsical, so some scenes feel goofy as a result

It meanders a bit, but it has some good moments throughout
Tags: tubi, folk horror: a study, britsploitation

Name: The Wicker Man
Review:
‚ÄúCorn rigs are bonny!‚Äù That‚Äôs not leaving my head anytime soon

Being a ‚Äúfan‚Äù of the Nic Cage version, I figured I owed the original a chance. Why didn‚Äôt you tell me it was good??

I‚Äôm glad the island is modern as opposed to the Amish-like folks in the newer version. It makes the more unusual elements stand out

Music seems constant, and it fluctuates between diegetic and non-diegetic. It‚Äôs hypnotic

The officer comes across a slo-mo make-out party in the yard. He‚Äôs a Catholic and engaged to be married, so he is‚Ä¶ tempted? Dude is way too tense and repressed. I can see why they‚Äôd choose a Nic Cage for a role like this

This is the most carefree I‚Äôve seen Christopher Lee in anything. He‚Äôs usually a villain or solving a mystery

Of course, May Day is when shit pops off. Masks, a bread representation of John Barleycorn, conspiracy to murder, kilts‚Ä¶

I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever seen a movie quite like this one, a welcome surprise, and a tense, outstanding experience
Tags: folk horror: a study, 1001 movies, britsploitation

Name: Dementia
Review:
Well, damn, if Preston Sturges likes it, by god, I should too

Lit like a noir and scored like an alien invasion flick, a woman walks through a world of violence ‚Äî a battered wife showing her bruise, a man stabbed in the street ‚Äî and sex ‚Äî the woman pimped out to an Orson Welles doppelg√§nger who takes her out to various night clubs where he can‚Äôt stop ogling the dancer ‚Äî where no one speaks a word

Psychotic episodes fragment the film, taking her to various places full of images of repression and sublimation ‚Äî we see actors repeated, scenes loop into one another ‚Äî this is the woman‚Äôs nightmare or her psychotic break

In some ways, it could be considered an American Un Chien Andalou with the sort of Freudian way it handles its story, but I think it has its own perversions on its mind

Regardless, it rules

Name: Morvern Callar
Review:
The uncomfortable quiet of Samantha Morton lying on the floor next to her boyfriend‚Äôs body, dead by suicide, lights on the Christmas tree flickering light and shadow across them. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt try to understand. It just felt like the right thing to do,‚Äù his suicide note reads. ‚ÄúBe brave.‚Äù

Lynn Ramsey loves her protagonists to be traumatized to the point of making confusing choices ‚Äî choices that only make sense in her mind, a mind we barely get to know otherwise

Here, the first choice is for Morton to leave the body right where she found it. The next is not to let anyone know that anything has happened as she goes out and parties with friends ‚Äî ‚ÄúI left him at home.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôve lost my boyfriend. Have you seen my boyfriend?‚Äù she calls out at the party, dissolving into the post-party quiet and the unwelcome reminder

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs gone away,‚Äù she finally says
‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be back,‚Äù everyone refrains

‚ÄúSome velvet morning when I am straight, I will open up the gate. ‚Äú

The movie is a journey of mourning and reclamation of what selfishness stole, ebbing between meditations on life and decay, disassociation, and the unwanted confrontation of reality ‚Äî running, always running away

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the same crap everywhere; stop dreaming.‚Äù

The movie, at times, slips into some indie clich√©s ‚Äî twirling around listening to music, baking and throwing flour everywhere, that sort of stuff ‚Äî but they tend to live in brief montages, nothing indulgent¬†

Stray Thoughts:
* As much as I love the Scottish accent, I cannae understand it in contemporary movies without subtitles
* They say ‚Äúfortnight‚Äù a few times. I didn‚Äôt know that was still in use
* Deeply jealous of how effortlessly she does a cat eye with her eyeliner
* ‚ÄúMorvern, you are so lovely to me,‚Äù her friend Lanna says, made me tear up
* Twee as hell 2002 soundtrack, but man, I love some of these songs
* I can only assume ‚Äúhoovering‚Äù used in this context is cocaine, right?
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, sight and sound, British Social Realism

Name: Pretty Poison
Review:
Anthony Perkins plays Dennis Pitt, a man recently released from a mental institution on parole. Cut to Dennis sitting outside a high school, watching the majorettes practice, picking his target for his next delusional fantasy ‚Äî that he is a CIA agent

He ‚Äúhires‚Äù Sue Ann ‚Äî Tuesday Weld ‚Äî to aid him in a convoluted plan to take down some alien poisoning plot. Sue Ann is more than game to play along, excited at the prospect of having someone who can look in on her mother‚Äôs boyfriend

Of course, they start hooking up, and the lies continue. Laying there in a post-sex haze, they talk about their feelings, and Sue Anne says, ‚ÄúI feel empty,‚Äù with a blank smile on her face

Things take a turn when, during a ‚Äúsabotage mission‚Äù at the plant Dennis works at, Sue Ann kills a guard and steals his gun. Not only that, she seems utterly unfazed by the whole ordeal¬†

This movie is a lot of fun in its own messed-up way. Perkins is great at being an okay liar who can‚Äôt keep it all together. Tuesday Weld is so funny and brilliant at how she plays off of Perkins

My biggest complaint is that, by today‚Äôs standards, the plot moves slowly, so you can see what‚Äôs coming early on. But the script is so full of weird jokes that it‚Äôs still enjoyable to be along for the ride

Stray Thoughts:
* Just jogging to work at the lumber yard in slacks and a dress shirt, nothing out of the ordinary
* I love how she says, ‚ÄúWhat?!‚Äù when he first introduces himself
* He has a zip-up hoodie that looks so modern. It‚Äôs uncanny
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, coming-of-age

Name: The Visit
Review: Watching for a podcast I‚Äôve been dreading this one. I‚Äôve seen a wide array of opinions, and I can‚Äôt tell who is irony-poisoned and who is genuine The kids are awful, and it definitely seems for comedic effect, but I suppose I‚Äôm not the audience for it. Or we‚Äôre supposed to root for bad things to happen to them? Thankfully, the ‚Äúgrandma‚Äù is a total weirdo, puking, scratching at the walls, and chasing the kids around. Like, she‚Äôs obviously not their grandma, right? When the grandpa said, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt go in the basement; there‚Äôs mold,‚Äù I was like, ‚ÄúRight, because that‚Äôs where the bodies are.‚Äù Maybe I would‚Äôve liked it more if I had seen it when it was Shyamalan‚Äôs ‚Äúreturn to form.‚Äù But it‚Äôs got creeps and spooks! It‚Äôs not so bad except for everything the kids say or do (and I guess demonizing older adults with mental disorders) Stray Thoughts * Immediately, Kathryn Hahn was onscreen, and I felt a sudden relief. Less than five minutes pass and Kathryn Hahn is no longer onscreen. Just as she disappears, ‚ÄúWritten and Directed by M. Night Shyamalan.‚Äù The horror begins * Oh no, this white kid is rapping with a particular affect‚Ä¶ and he does it more than once * ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not a Yahtzee master. That takes ten years‚Äù Okay, movie, you got me, I laughed * I could have done without the diaper stuff

Name: Misery
Review:
Misery is, by most accounts, a success. Two standout lead performances ‚Äî Kathy Bates is perfect as every nurse I‚Äôve ever met ‚Äî a quirky script that both honors and exceeds Stephen King's work by tip-toeing between horror and comedy at the proper measures for a mainstream audience ‚Äî namely, erring on the side of fluffy and heightened ‚Äî and cinematography that exaggerates the highs and lows to keep even the quieter moments watchable

‚ÄúI‚Äôm your number one fan. There‚Äôs nothing to worry about. You‚Äôll be fine. I‚Äôll take care of you.‚Äù

I wish I could go to a world where this wasn‚Äôt the subject of so much parody to experience this with fresh eyes. I think I would appreciate what this is doing more

Still, it does what it does well, even when most of it feels a bit too familiar
Tags: torrent, switchblade sisters, house of psychotic women

Name: The Ghost Goes West
Review: Beautiful cinematography, especially when Peggy first meets the ghost outside on an overcast night, the composition of his reveal, the shadow cast just over his face The miniatures and sets are also great ‚Äî another one of Claire's strengths Once they find out the ghost is confirmed, a bidding war begins for who owns the spirit so that they can sell admission to see it ‚Äî reminiscent of Beetlejuice, except crossing over is the desired outcome This is the second film I've watched in the "disgraced ghost who must bring honor back to his family before he can pass on into the next life" genre ‚Äî the other being The Canterville Ghost Murdoch appearing at the dinner was terrific! They did like a reverse explosion and a massive gust of wind blowing 12ft curtains, legit chills It took me a bit to warm up to this, but once it got going, it won me over Stray Thoughts * I, too, would instead be playing in the field with women than go to war * A little premonitory, the idea of a castle in Florida becoming a public attraction * "And now, we're gonna hear some real Scotch music!" Enter: a twelve-piece band in kilts playing swing
Tags: criterion channel, frightfest guide to ghost movies

Name: Ratcatcher
Review: What an opening! Another piece of media reminding me how fucked Glasgow is Tonally, it reminds me a lot of Kes, the way it focuses on the cruelty of childhood, albeit with a bleaker thread running throughout and no sense of relief I have a hard time with social realism that feels brutal for the sake of it, which this does a few times, but it doesn't devolve into full "Kids" edge lord territory The scene with the mice on the moon is bittersweet but feels out of place compared to the other moments with James' imagination. I know it's intentional, but it's not a choice that works for me. Then again, it will probably be the scene that sticks with me the longest Ultimately what makes this work is how personal the story is. For Lynn Ramsay's first feature, the movie feels relatively cohesive. I don't love it as much as her other films I've seen, but its good www.glasgowlive.co.uk/news/history/1975-glasgow-dustmen-strikes-rats-17323843
Tags: criterion channel, criterion, films made by women set in rural areas, british social realism, psychogeography, written by women, directed by women, edited by women, coming-of-age

Name: Small Deaths
Review: Terrence Malick-core

Name: Are You There God? It's Me, Margaret.
Review: Life is what happens when you‚Äôre busy making plans and no longer praying to god I cried ‚Äî Hans Zimmer played up the schmaltz, but the movie found some real emotional moments and took the time to earn them. Obviously, there wasn‚Äôt a whole lot for me to relate to, but the performances kept me locked in The most relatable scene to me was going to a party in middle school where we did the ‚Äúgo in a room with another person and ‚Ä¶ üòè‚Äù and Anna Smith and I just banged on the door and yelled a bunch, because god made me scared of sex/desire/whatnot Benny Safdie and Rachel McAdams are the parents we all wish we could have ‚Äî they‚Äôre not perfect, but damn, are they trying The grandparents are my grandparents, who still give me Max Lucado books for Christmas. One time they gave me a desk organizer, and I really needed one, so I was so thankful, and I could tell how mad they were that it was that and not God Will Carry You Through¬†that received such thanks Happy I saw this in a theater full of weepies like me

Name: Ugetsu
Review:
THE defining Jidaigeki ghost film. It has many imitators, also great, but this one set the blueprint

Such beautiful lighting and cinematography ‚Äî the boat in the fog sets down such a sense of unease; the vision of his wife receiving the kimono he worked so hard to buy for her; the slipping further into idyllic, surreal images; the moment when his wife is sewing just before dawn ‚Äî every scene has something special

Killer soundtrack, too. Really uncomfortable stuff

Hard to overhype this one. It‚Äôs pretty special
Tags: torrent, karagarga, 1001 movies, criterion, sight and sound, kaidan

Name: Nausica√§ of the Valley of the Wind
Review:
This is the earliest Miyazaki film I‚Äôve seen, and while it doesn‚Äôt feel as mature, it still has some cool ideas, very M≈ìbius-inspired

So bored with wars! I don‚Äôt care about airship battles

I don‚Äôt know what to say, I just didn‚Äôt have a good time watching this. I appreciate the world building and craft of it, but I never latched onto the story or the characters. I recognize it‚Äôs a good movie, it just isn‚Äôt for me

Maybe I need to take a break from Miyazaki

Name: Hellboy
Review:
Hellboy is one of the few comic series I read all ‚Äî or the majority ‚Äî of. So, I‚Äôve been a little nervous about coming to the adaptations

The one time Del Toro and Rob Perlman‚Äôs long-standing relationship pays off; Perlman is about as good a Hellboy as you‚Äôre ever going to get

The CGI monster fights are boring ‚Äî as good as the CGI is for 2004, there are still too many lighting and texture issues to make them as immersive as the rest of the movie

It‚Äôs hard to tell if the fight scenes are slow or if this was just the pace of fight scenes then

I appreciate how they try to bring you up to speed on the lore, but it‚Äôs still pretty hamfisted especially the Liz plotline

As much as I like Hellboy, there‚Äôs no personality to this, and the script is terrible. Of course, I‚Äôm still going to watch Hellboy 2

Stray Thoughts
* Funniest use of the song Red Right Hand in a movie?
* Having to rescue a crate of kittens during a monster fight is pretty funny

Name: Polite Society
Review: What The Hell? This movie rules! Great pacing and editing, so many fun cuts and music queues, the fights are thematic and cool, hilarious, and the perfect ending! It wears its influences on its sleeve ‚Äî a little Guy Richie, a touch of Oceans 11, and some Tarantino-style soundtrack with a healthy dose of Bollywood-esque score, among others ‚Äî but it all fits together nicely and doesn‚Äôt feel like pastiche My only major complaint is some of the third-act pacing, but it's not egregious ‚Äî it just has a lot of notes it has to come back around on Well worth staying up past my bedtime for. See it in the theater before a Marvel takes it out!

Name: Shanghai Express
Review: I love how in medias res this movie starts. Eveyone knows someone on the train, everyone has a secret, and most importantly, the film isn‚Äôt interested in filling in most of those stories for you ‚Äî fitting considering how much spy work is happening in the background The camera looks through shadows cast on pulled curtains and a veil of darkness to people‚Äôs backs and silhouettes ‚Äî you are another stranger on the train, learning what you are privileged to see The Americans and Brits are insufferable and racist and make the ride worse for everyone around them. I get the intent, but it does become unbearable at times Marlene Dietrich carries herself with such charm and wit. The camera knows how to fill the screen with her face so that we get every subtle change as she fluctuates between flirtatious and sincere Perfect lighting! The moment with the soldiers in the fog sneaking onto the train gave me chills. Also when Dietrich is in complete shadow except for her bejeweled hands joined together in prayer One of the best early Hollywood movies I‚Äôve seen ‚Äî so intelligent and captivating. I would die if I ever had the opportunity to see this in a theater ¬† ‚ÄúThe Chinese government would‚Äôve had my head years ago if it wasn‚Äôt such a good head‚Äù ‚Äî iconic

Name: Bunny Lake Is Missing
Review: Excellent opening credits with the paper tear revealing the title and credits ‚Äî of course, it‚Äôs Saul Bass Like Maris to Niles Crane, Bunny is spoken of but not seen. We know she‚Äôs in the First Day room, left in the care of someone cooking in the kitchen A Karen‚Äôs validation, the school is full of inept teachers and supervisors who need the mother to take the initiative in finding her. And when she speaks to the manager, the manager is on her side! But yeah, that kid is gone. Or‚Ä¶ A frenetic camera chases the characters around, zooming in wildly on faces and objects The movie spends an awfully long time moving through the initial minutiae of the investigation, but all the details seem to matter as things take, well, unexpected turns What an upsetting movie, what a pleasant surprise¬† Stray Thoughts * Weirdo landlords must have small pets. Jesus, that dude sucks * Hell yeah, Zombies on the television * Doll Hospital. What a nightmare * I did not recognize Laurence Olivier without his little mustache!

Name: But I'm a Cheerleader
Review: Excellent 90s color palate. Truly obsessed with all of the duo-tone scenes The formula is pretty threadbare, but the execution is cozy. And you have to appreciate queer representation and gender deconstruction that‚Äôs well-made and funny I‚Äôm just over conversion therapy as a central plot point to a queer story. Thankfully, this is such a silly, satirical approach that it isn‚Äôt quite as painful, but the parents still say some rough stuff. Also, I don‚Äôt miss the 90s and the comfort everyone had with the F-slur Still, happy this exists! Stray Thoughts * Ru Paul with a goatee is barely recognizable * This is the most earnest I‚Äôve seen Natasha Lyonne * Thank god Melanie Lynsky gets to speak in her Kiwi accent * Oh, hey, Rufio! * All the cutouts in the boys' training area are hilarious
Tags: tubi, queer, coming-of-age, written by women, directed by women, good for her, solidarity

Name: In the Cut
Review:
The male gaze is inverted, not (only) giving us the female gaze, but the experience of one who is within the gaze of several men

The camera blurs at the edges ‚Äî Meg Ryan is on guard by default, and the world is only let in through narrow apertures ‚Äî frenetic and dodgy, yet still managing to see

After the murder of Angela Sands, we see the consequence of being observed ‚Äî the beauty and sex are severed from the human to whom it belongs ‚Äî the head severed from the body and left behind

Yet, in this world of blood and violence, the desire for love ‚Äî the desire to not just be seen but understood ‚Äî remains. And so, despite that instinct that says to run, Ryan opens up a little and experiences something with Mark Ruffalo, who believes he knows exactly what women want ‚Äî and sometimes he might, but good head is not the (only) key to love

And we also get to see Mark Ruffalo‚Äôs penis, so that‚Äôs pretty neat

Name: Don't Panic
Review: Where can I buy those dinosaur pajamas?

Name: Witchboard
Review:
Pretty solid setup ‚Äî at a party, Stephen Nichols introduces Tawny Kitaen to Ouija and the spirit of an 8-year-old boy named Danny. Her husband, Todd Allen, is drunk and irritable, stirring the ire of Danny

Kitaen continues to speak to Danny through the Ouija board, and something is causing havoc in Jim‚Äôs life. Kitaen grows edgier as she learns she is pregnant and wonders if Danny may be reborn as the child

The primary issue with this movie is that it barely functions as a horror movie until the third act. There are some neat dream sequences and jump scares up to that point. And even still, the final scenes feel like they‚Äôre from a different movie altogether

The movie takes time for character beats, which I kind of like, but they feel odd more than anything¬†

Kitaen gives a great performance ‚Äî this movie does not deserve it. It sucks that her reputation is as the girl in the Whitesnake videos because she could‚Äôve done a lot more¬†

Stephen Nichols is alright. His eyes do 3/4 of the work ‚Äî and like a true soap star, he‚Äôs best in the melodramatic scenes

Overall, not a bad experience, just not one I would go out of my way to recommend¬†

Stray Thoughts
* Burke Byrnes is the cheeriest homicide detective ever put onscreen. His obsession with magic is pretty endearing
* Zarabeth the medium rules ‚Äî true style icon

Name: High Tension
Review: I saw Aja‚Äôs remake of The Hills Have Eyes in high school, and it was the first time I had seen a movie that violent ‚Äî the first half felt so over-the-top I couldn‚Äôt process what I was experiencing ‚Äî and the first time I felt that sense of vindication and cheering for violence during the second-half revenge. I anticipated something akin to that in this movie Cecile de France is on a trip to visit Maiwenn‚Äôs family. Maiwenn fixated on a taken boy, de France on Maiwenn, fingering herself to reggae ‚Äî the sexiest genre ‚Äî while the camera takes turns looking at all of the sleeping family members who will inevitably be murdered Somewhere in the background is a trucker who likes to auto-fellate employing a decapitated head, who pulls up to the house unprovoked, ringing the bell with his oily hands and initiating his spree A taut movie up to a point (see spoilers below for an explanation), and once that point happens, it is dumb as hell Is it gory? Yeah, dude, it‚Äôs gory. Is it sub-90 minutes? Hell yeah, it is. Is it worth seeing? Not really ***SPOILERS*** If the opening dream sequence isn‚Äôt a dead giveaway, there is a twist that‚Ä¶ doesn‚Äôt work. Logistically, it doesn‚Äôt make any sense. The filmmakers would be better off just letting it be some dude and sticking closer to the revenge film formula instead of trying to upturn it as carelessly as this
