Name: The Laughing Woman
Review: A rich man abducts his new assistant with the intent of torturing her and then murdering her at the point of orgasm Thankfully, the movie has a bit more in mind than (just) prurience, and the game of domination morphs into one of humiliation and exposing the childish fear at the heart of sadism, as well as the irony of power embedded in masochism I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôve ever seen a movie so of it‚Äôs time ‚Äî the fashion choices, the car park with the horizontal wood-paneled doors, the trippy art piece of the spread legs with teeth in between them The whole film has an espionage tone ‚Äî maybe that‚Äôs just childhood inundation of this era‚Äôs James Bond films. No, it‚Äôs the car that they drive around in the water ‚Äî I‚Äôve seen that in a Bond movie The movie can get away with many insane choices by never being anything other than insane. It‚Äôs nothing brilliant, but it has more than a few ideas, however oversimplified the execution may be Stray Thoughts * The blowup replica of himself reminds me of Tracy Jordan buying a life-size sex doll of himself * ‚Äúsexual aberrations and the stars‚Äù is a good band name * The woodwind quartet playing on the back of the train while he gets road head ‚Äî pretty funny
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, Sexploitation

Name: The Blood Spattered Bride
Review: The template for the majority of psychological horror movies ‚Äî especially those in which dreams/visions invade someone‚Äôs reality ‚Äî lies in this film (not that it invented anything, just that it exemplifies that formula) We get the prototypical haunted child who is the only voice that gives credence to what was thought illusory We also get the fear of a social change ‚Äî here, women‚Äôs lib and lesbianism ‚Äî conveyed through the fear of the wife that she doesn‚Äôt actually love her husband or want to be with him anymore. Camilla is that fear made manifest, that latent desire to kill her husband and end it all Cool movie! It has a bit of a lull before the third act, but nothing heinous Stray Thoughts * Showing up in red to a wedding is such a faux pas * Oh hey, it‚Äôs dark Nathan Fielder! I initially saw Simon Andreu in The Forbidden Photos of a Lady Above Suspicion *** SPOILERS*** Towards the end, some imagery evokes the husband as the state trying to shut down a rebellion ‚Äî the way the girl in the red shirt puts her head down, hands outstretched, as he shoots her in the back of the head. Maybe talking out of my ass, though

Name: May
Review: Angela Bettis is May, a girl who grew up with a lazy eye and a mother that couldn‚Äôt bear imperfection. Unable to make friends, her mother gives her a homemade doll named Soozy to be her friends As an adult, she is a vet tech by day, a tailor by night, who fixates on people‚Äôs body parts ‚Äî her coworker‚Äôs neck, this cute boy‚Äôs hands ‚Äî but never really got the whole socialization down Angela Bettis is perfect in this. She has a lot of notes to hit, and she does it all so well God, this movie fucked with me. It‚Äôs so hard to be funny, grotesque, earnest, and successfully so ‚Äî it broke my heart and made me gag. What more can you ask for? Stray Thoughts (Spoiler-ish?) * Scalpel play makes me cringe so much! * Argento‚Äôs Opera poster in his room, retractable knife on the mantle, diet weirdo * Blind kids feeling around in broken glass made me cringe too! * The swirl of blood and milk on the kitchen floor looks cool
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, killer toy

Name: Alice in Wonderland
Review:
Great costumes, the deck of cards was cute, and the only scene that looked meh was the initial growing and shrinking because it looks filmed on a stage, whereas the rest has sets

Last I read, this was lost, so I‚Äôm so glad we have some version of it, even if it‚Äôs damaged and 4 minutes are still lost

Name: Evil Dead
Review: I liked Don‚Äôt Breathe, I liked Jane Levy in it, and I‚Äôm going to see Evil Dead Rise tonight, so it seemed like I ought to check this out I‚Äôm not an OG Evil Dead devotee ‚Äî despite seeing Bruce Campbell make fun of some nerds a little while ago ‚Äî so there was nothing sacred to them that this remake could sully. That said, I will mention stuff I think is better/worse between the originals and this Jane Levy came to the cabin with friends and her brother to throw her stash down a well and get clean. This isn‚Äôt the first time she has tried to get clean, so they‚Äôre not going to let her leave, no matter what As it goes in these cabins in the woods, they discover dozens of dead cats and a book wrapped in barbed wire. So, of course, they unwrap it. And with every warning in the book that says not to say what is in the book out loud, they ignore it and summon something The thing summoned shows itself to Jane Levy, so you know, she‚Äôd like to leave‚Ä¶ you see where this is going The camera does the movement from the originals to convey the spirit moving through the woods, which is neat. In fact, a lot of cinematography nods to Sam Raimi The pacing on this is better than the originals ‚Äî or maybe it utilizes more contemporary tropes so it moves in a more familiar way Despite the chaos of this, I never felt like the demon acted unpredictably. It was always some iteration of ‚Äúsomething gory and a lot of screaming‚Äù or ‚ÄúNo, it‚Äôs me, I‚Äôm back, help me!‚Äù Not inherently wrong, but not interesting on its own Overall, pretty fun! Not the banger that Don‚Äôt Breathe was, but far from the worst thing I‚Äôve seen. Definitely among the goriest, though! Stray Thoughts * Nice CG Jeep driving over a river * ‚ÄúGrandpa‚Äù is a good dog name * That meat is old! I get it, you wanted it to bleed for the transition, but it‚Äôs gray ü§Æ * ‚Äúdying wouldn‚Äôt be so bad right now‚Ä¶ I just don‚Äôt want to become the devil‚Äôs bitch!‚Äù

Name: From Beyond
Review:
Dream team collaborators Brian Yuzna and Stuart Gordon, as well as dream thruple participants Jeffrey Combs and Barbara Crampton, reunite for another HP Lovecraft adaptation

Jeffrey Combs plays a belligerent scientist mistaken for a schizophrenic man whose partner‚Äôs invention, The Resonator, increases the size of the pineal gland, allowing him to experience an alien creature, and in the process, accidentally killing his partner

Barbara Crampton is a psychiatrist who believes Combs after a CAT scan reveals that his pineal gland has, in fact, grown. She helps release Combs into her custody so that they can recreate the experiment together

We learn about pineal gland monitors sexual stimulation, so these horny kids get into some hijinks!

Good to know we‚Äôd all have leather kinks and be schizophrenic if our pineal glands were bigger

A wet, slimy adventure ‚Äî signature Yuzna shit. Everyone goes all out, leaving taste at the door, and it‚Äôs all the better for it. Absolutely bonkers. I love it

* Nice ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Tread on Me‚Äù flag with the alien worm on it. I guess it‚Äôs not an homage to noted racist HP Lovecraft without some far-right imagery¬†
* Did Silence of the Lambs steal its psyche ward intro from this??
* He lives at 666 Benevolent Street. Nice

Name: Evil Dead Rise
Review:
As I said in my Evil Dead remake review, I don‚Äôt have a strong tie to the original movies, so there‚Äôs nothing precious about them that this movie could sully

Compared to the remake, this is a more chaotic and fun experience. It retains the remake‚Äôs gore and viscera but tries much harder to develop characters and themes. They‚Äôre not vibrant characters, and it‚Äôs not a subtle theme ‚Äî if I can‚Äôt care for these kids, can I be a good mother? ‚Äî but it allows the movie to have a shape

Pacing-wise, it‚Äôs hit-or-miss. It never builds off its previous scare, so it doesn‚Äôt have the original‚Äôs relentlessness. But I liked that? The originals got exhausting in a way this one avoided

I also liked how the book was discovered, and the demon summoned

Overall, not bad, very gross, and so on

Name: Beau Is Afraid
Review:
During the pandemic, I read Charlie Kaufman‚Äôs book Antkind. Initially, I was into the mixed-up world he established, where everything was out to get him, and he was constantly misunderstood. But then, as the book progressed, Kaufman grew tired of that and changed the scenery, and he did that over and over again for 720 pages

It was reading this book that I realized how desperately Kaufman needs an editor or a second person in the room to get him to somewhere focused and compelling for anyone other than boys who put women in two buckets: mommy or bitch

I‚Äôve always given points for audacity in filmmaking, even if it leaves me cold. I think I‚Äôm ready to cut that chain and just let shit be shit

Parker Posey deserves the world, though

Name: Red Desert
Review:
What is the color of lust? The color of sex with a stranger? The color of greed? The color of poison ‚Äî the place you refuse to let your mind go?

Red, pink, green, yellow

And what do you do when the world turns gray ‚Äî the walls the fruit at the stand, the people in the streets. What do you do when the world grows still, envelops in fog, loses focus? Where do you look? How do you live? Aren‚Äôt they the same question?

Perhaps what we call sickness is just the alienation we feel in an industrial wasteland ‚Äî where meaning is assigned to work and you are between things ‚Äî where children‚Äôs toys are erector sets, lab equipment, models of factories ‚Äî where the waters of your childhood are no longer blue, and the rocks that looked like human skin are no longer singing ‚Äî where there is one too many mysteries to solve and the lack of answers is intolerable

You could try to take your own life, only to survive with the stigma hovering over you. Or you could jump aboard a boat, only to find that they don‚Äôt speak your language. Or you could walk with your child through the factory smog, only for him to see the same yellow that you see erupting from the stacks

I wanted to end on a positive note, but this movie is a bummer. I can understand why after this, Vitti told Antonioni to fuck off and do comedies. Find your community, the world needs you here!
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, 1001 movies, sight and sound, criterion

Name: Huesera: The Bone Woman
Review:
Natalia Soli√°n is trying to get pregnant. At the start of the movie, her family takes her on a pilgrimage to a huge Virgin Mary statue to ask for help

Once pregnant, she realizes all that she has to give up ‚Äî not just smoking, woodworking due to the associated chemicals ‚Äî leaving her on edge, cracking her knuckles, contorting her back

On top of that, she keeps seeing a strange person, their face obscured, their bones cracking and breaking as they move

Of course, her partner blames lack of sleep, the pregnancy, etc. ‚Äî classic Rosemary‚Äôs Baby-style gaslighting. Still, the person comes closer, seeming to want the baby

In flashbacks, we learn of her lesbian punk past and the choices she made to leave it and her then-girlfriend behind

The film deals with identity ‚Äî who you were, who you‚Äôre trying to be ‚Äî and how much you can tear yourself apart trying to be the right person

It feels more in line with films like The Babadook in terms of the type of terror that manifests is sparse, and the drama of her life is the primary focus

That said, it makes its own choices about the trajectory the story takes, and those choices make all the difference

Not a very scary movie, but well-crafted

Stray Thoughts
* The crib she makes a pretty cool with the diagonal bars and spider web design ‚Äî spiders and webs being a recurring motif in the movie (and a psychic tells her that she‚Äôs caught in something‚Äôs web, so not subtle)

Name: Solaris
Review: Not a horrible offense, just an uninteresting take on the source material

Name: Burnt Offerings
Review: A family ‚Äî mother, daughter, son, aunt ‚Äî moves out into the country to rent an old mansion for the summer. The place is decadent, yet the owners ask for a cheap price. The only exception ‚Äî the owners‚Äô 85-year-old mother will stay in the house with them ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs practically immortal ‚Äî I sincerely believe that,‚Äù says Eileen Heckart, one of the owners, regarding the house and its upkeep Karen Black, the mother, is eager to take the offer, but the father, Oliver Reed, is skeptical, especially of the owners leaving their owners behind. Nevertheless, they agree to take up the offer Soon after they arrive, the son falls and cuts his knee while playing outside ‚Äî something Burgess Meredith, one of the owners, tries to hide from the family The mother becomes obsessed with caring for the house, polishing old pictures, and tending to the older woman whom no one has seen since they moved in The father, roughhousing with his son in the pool, goes too far and nearly drowns the son, seemingly intentionally. The following day, he is riddled with guilt, unsure of what happened to him. Stranger still, the pool looks completely renovated, apparently brand new Like, this is obviously the inspiration for The Shining ‚Äî not that this invented the house that needs blood to survive, but the family dynamics and general structure are too similar to be ignored The quiet intensity of the final sequence is so smart, deferring its final reveal until the last moment I enjoyed this one a good bit! Stray Thoughts * Trying to make Oliver Reed look like an average dad when he has that face * The kid brings Twister to the house ‚Äî who exactly does he expect to play Twister with him?

Name: Toys Are Not for Children
Review:
Jamie, an adult woman, lives with her mother and still gets toys yearly from her estranged father. As a result, she develops an unhealthy fixation on toys as her one connection to her father

Her mother catches her masturbating with one of the toys and kicks her out of the house. She moves into the city, gets a job at a toy store, and marries one of her coworkers, who only learns of her toy obsession when she won‚Äôt go to bed on their wedding night without one of them

This is only the first 10 minutes of what ends up being a troubling and complex exploration of abandonment and neglect and the lessons kids learn to survive abusive childhoods

On the surface, the mediocre acting, awkward dialogue, and cheap film stock make the film feel like just another exploitation film. And it is an exploitation film committed to being lurid and controversial ‚Äî I don‚Äôt think it handles any of its subject matter tastefully ‚Äî  yet it manages to find moments that feel authentic

The movie effectively uses nonlinear flashbacks and juxtaposition to show Jamie‚Äôs thought process and unfold the repressed person that still idolizes her father. It‚Äôs not subtle, but it evokes genuine emotion and builds the tension

Marcia Forbes is well-cast as the adult yet childlike Jamie, who always feels like a child when onscreen. This movie is her only role before retiring from acting, and I can‚Äôt say I blame her

Overall, it‚Äôs a pretty fucked up movie with broken characters and no happy endings in mind ‚Äî maybe one of the most upsetting endings I‚Äôve seen. It‚Äôs just surprisingly successful filmmaking for a roughie
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, Sexploitation

Name: I Never Promised You a Rose Garden
Review: After a suicide attempt, Kathleen Quinlan, playing 16-year-old Deborah, is admitted to an institution. Straight away, we experience the whispers that are in her head ‚Äî ‚Äútraitor‚Äù, ‚Äúsecrets‚Äù ‚Äî and a person in stereotypical tribal clothing and face paint that does not appear to be real More and more, fantasy intersects with reality, in which tribe-like gods rule and who forces her to hurt herself as penance Her time in the institution is populated with the theater kid version of insanity, where everyone performs song and dance, disassociating or instigating fights. I can‚Äôt speak to the realism; it‚Äôs just cliche, especially post-One Flew Over the Cuckoo‚Äôs Nest The real heart of the movie is in the individual therapy sessions with Bibi Andersson, where Deborah expresses her private language and learns, little by little, how to trust someone other than herself and how to experience genuine human pain The passage of time in the movie is horrifying, where a couple of days feel like they have passed, and those lead to years lost. Still, as a viewer, it‚Äôs hard not to feel like the ending is sudden and maybe even unearned Overall, not a stellar movie, but it found moments of warmth that helped it through Stray Thoughts * Dennis Quaid and Clint Howard show up in the movie's last five minutes? It‚Äôs not a spoiler, they‚Äôre just playing baseball * Nice homage to Christina‚Äôs World, but a tad on the nose, yeah?

Name: That Cold Day in the Park
Review:
Sandy Dennis passes a boy ‚Äî Michael Burns ‚Äî in the park on her way home to her apartment, still able to see him from her window as the family arrives and eats a decadent meal on fine china. During their visit, the rain begins, and she cannot stop looking and worrying about the boy

She invites him to dry off, bathe, and eat a hot meal. In talking to him, she learns that he cannot (or will not) speak

As she cares for him, she makes it clear just how lonely she is, and though the boy is under no obligation to stay, she offers him a bed, food, clothing

One night, we see him escape and go home, his home, with a large family. In talking with his sister ‚Äî yes, he talks ‚Äî we learn of a game he plays where he doesn‚Äôt speak and lets other people fill in the gaps

He returns and continues the game, and boy, is it a messy game

Throughout the movie, Dennis looks through distorted windows and mirrors, her face or the boy‚Äôs face morphed or fractured ‚Äî classic psycho-thriller stuff

It is a great first half, but the second half rushes through some plot and arrives at a place that doesn‚Äôt feel motivated by what came before. I have no problems with where it arrived ‚Äî and I expected it to reach where it did. I just thought it needed more groundwork to get there

Name: Happy Birthday to Me
Review: A girl walks home alone at night, accosted by someone with black gloves. When she thinks she‚Äôs found a friend, she sees the black gloves on them and a straight razor in their hands ‚Äî we don‚Äôt see to whom the black gloves belong Cut to Melissa Sue Anderson (Virginia) showing up to the bar late to meet her friends, soon followed by Jack Blum (Alfred), who is bullied by the rest of the group. The group pulls some hijinks with the Shriners at the bar and drives off in their fancy cars ‚Äî save Alfred, who putters off on a moped Later, we learn that Virginia's mother is dead and that she is repressing the memories, so to help her remember her father and her move back into their old home where they all lived together. From there, the movie speeds off into insanity The movie is a murder fest, each one with a creative flare, twisting and turning as much as possible to keep you off the scent Is it Virginia disassociating? Is it Alfred getting revenge? Is it Steve who seems to be stalking Virginia? Get ready to tune out occasionally, then check back on the movie and say, ‚ÄúWhat the hell?‚Äù It‚Äôs all pretty silly, and they really go out of their way for some misdirects, but if you go in knowing that, it‚Äôs an enjoyable experience. You won‚Äôt marvel at the filmmaking, but if horror is a comfort food, this is a treat I would love to watch this again with friends strAy thoughts * Pretty Little Liars fans will appreciate the all-black outfit of the killer * They‚Äôll also enjoy the bell tower that plays into the plot * This might just be a bloodier Pretty Little Liars
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, video nasties, canuxploitation, slasher, special day horror, coming-of-age

Name: Songs from the Second Floor
Review:
Cold, dead-pan, absurdist, darkly funny ‚Äî a series of still shots, some connected or intersected, but several different little stories. Everyone‚Äôs faces are a pale white, and many of the characters are what you might call ‚Äúconventionally unattractive.‚Äù All of the stories seem to deal with misery in some way. Perhaps the hell of corporate life or life after work has used you up? It‚Äôs a world of ash and blood and falling stock prices, where poetry drives you insane, and business people flagellate each other in the streets

It‚Äôs a beautiful movie to look at, and I don‚Äôt know of anyone else to compare the tone of it to ‚Äî it falls along the same lines as Bu√±uel or Tati but has a unique perspective

Incredible ending

Name: Road to Salina
Review: Rocky (Robert Walker Jr) drives off in a yellow convertible, leaving Mara (Rita Hayworth) at the gas station, crying in the pouring rain. His car dies, so he hitches a ride to the police station. Riding back with the cop, Rocky tells his story on the road to Salina. Or is it Jonas telling the story? By pretending to be Rocky, Jonas gets himself entrenched in the life of Mara, Rocky‚Äôs mother, with the promise to Warren (Ed Begley), Mara‚Äôs friend, that he‚Äôll never leave them again Once Rocky‚Äôs sister Billie (Mimsy Farmer) arrives, we learn of the investigation into Rocky‚Äôs disappearance, and Jonas worries he may have entered a game whose rules he doesn‚Äôt know. Still, he commits to solidifying his life as Rocky, and all of the covert measures that require ‚Äî including the scenario where the real Rocky shows up As Billie and Jonas grow closer, their relationship grows weirder, and we‚Äôre left wondering if this dynamic ‚Äî and the brief mentions of Linda (Sophie Hardy), Warren‚Äôs daughter, who caused a riff between Billie and Jonas ‚Äî has anything to do with Rocky‚Äôs disappearance ‚ÄúSo it starts up all over again,‚Äù says Mara The twists and revelations continue as Jonas grows more entangled in these people‚Äôs lives. Salina, the supposed destination, holds all the answers, but the cost of learning them may be too high I‚Äôm used to these mistaken identity movies being played for laughs, so it‚Äôs hard not to laugh at the scenes where people ask Jonas to recall their shared past. As always, they are more than willing to fill in the gaps and let Jonas save face I ended up enjoying this a good bit. It‚Äôs nothing exceptional, but I was engrossed throughout Stray Thoughts * Robert Walker Jr looks like Clint Eastwood‚Äôs stunt double * The lounge jazz version of Bouree is so funny * Wow, this is the first Rita Hayworth movie I have watched ‚Äî I didn‚Äôt realize

Name: Four Flies on Grey Velvet
Review: An explosion of drums, a beating heart, a man outside in a trench coat and sunglasses ‚Äî a band recording together in a studio, a fly buzzing in the drummer‚Äôs face that he crushes in the high-hat The pursuit begins ‚Äî even though we have no idea what the hell is going on ‚Äî and the drummer Roberto (Michael Brandon) accidentally stabs the man in a trench coat, killing him. Not only that, someone in a child mask photographs the whole event Tormented by the events, he lays in bed tossing and turning next to his wife, Nina (Mimsy Farmer), who doesn‚Äôt seem to care what has happened But the person who saw it developed the film, and is messing with Roberto, sending him the dead man‚Äôs passport and hiding photos of the event in his house ‚ÄúI could kill you, but I don‚Äôt want to,‚Äù the masked person whispers, rope wrapped around Roberto‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúWho can you turn to? You‚Äôre all alone.‚Äù Well, he turns to a guy named God and a parrot named Jerk Off. Okay, the man‚Äôs real name is Godfrey (Bud Spencer), and in addition to his parrot, he has an associate he calls The Professor. How are they going to help? Beats me! I only included that part because a guy called God is pretty funny. The plot splinters further from here, with the maid trying to blackmail the person in the mask, Nina‚Äôs cousin coming to visit, someone being in and out of an asylum, etc. I just don‚Äôt care. I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm supposed to be invested in. The plot twists, and we don‚Äôt see how the game changes or why there‚Äôs a game in the first place. Even in the end, the killer‚Äôs villain monologue is almost entirely unrelated to what we‚Äôve seen up to that point Looks good, though. Not Suspiria good, but some neat shots. Although, no one ever accused Argento of filming a bad-looking picture (well, not his early movies, at least) And how it‚Äôs solved, as convoluted as it is, is pretty amusing ‚Äî it involves capturing an image from the retinas of the dead person of what they saw just before they died Argento completists (and Mimsy Farmer fans) will find something to enjoy Stray Thoughts * Sweet kitty falling asleep, I audibly ‚ÄúAww!‚Äù-d * The PI‚Äôs eye-shaped door handle is neat. ‚ÄúOh, you heterosexuals!‚Äù the PI says * A lot of cat murders :(
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, giallo

Name: The Snake Pit
Review:
Virginia (Olivia de Havilland) is sitting on a bench in a park, not knowing where she is. Though we realize she is in an asylum, she cannot deduce where she is or why she is there. She hears voices that convince her not to trust people, even if she thinks she knows them

Through her husband Robert (Mark Stevens), we learn how they met, how he came to recognize her erratic behavior and memory lapses, and her eventual nervous breakdown

Her doctor, Dr. Kik (Leo Genn), initiates performing regular shock treatment on Virginia, sees minimal effect but continues session after session. It takes time and therapy to figure out her story so that she can understand it and reframe it in a way that makes life more bearable

Olivia de Havilland is so good in this. For a 1940s movie about mental illness, she leans towards a more human and considered performance ‚Äî I learned that she went to several institutions and spent time with actual patients to understand the character better. It took no time for me to care about her, and seeing her cared for

Nurses from these institutions worked to get some of the darker material cut from the film, but we get a glimpse of it in the snake pit ‚Äî the room of women nearly stacked on top of each other, snapping at each other, unable to relate to one another, unable to get out

The story may have saccharine overtones, but it initiated movements in the US to improve the conditions of mental institutions

Good movie! Very hard to find, but I am glad I found a copy

Stray Thoughts
* I want to go to the best soda shop in town!
* All the women gathered around the nurse with a lit match to light their cigarettes ‚Äî big mood
* Everyone singing Dvorak‚Äôs ‚ÄúGoin‚Äô Home‚Äù at the dance was so sad
* A movie where the leads don‚Äôt end up in love? That‚Äôs an achievement in and of itself
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, 1001 movies

Name: Singapore Sling
Review:
A man called Singapore Sling goes looking for his missing love Laura and ends up held captive by two women who do, uh, all sorts of stuff to him

It‚Äôs like a film noir crashed its car into a sex comedy from hell. The switch from horny to gross to funny happens within seconds, and I don‚Äôt want any of it

It‚Äôs also a beautiful and singular vision that I can‚Äôt look away from

Name: Nope
Review: Jordan Peele has cornered a specific method of making movies ‚Äî something visually striking with a lot of set pieces, and if things work out, they‚Äôll thematically fit together in the end Us is a great movie visually, but it requires a lot of leaps to have any coherent meaning. Nope is even worse at this, and I refuse to jump through the hoops here to get at something more profound. I‚Äôm not saying you can‚Äôt do it or that there isn‚Äôt anything deeper going on in the movie, just that I‚Äôm not interested in that conversation Functionally, this is a lot closer to Shyamalan than Spielberg, where every tiny detail of the movie is put there for a third act ‚Äúoh shit!‚Äù that only sometimes serves the film itself Overall, this is an expensive, ‚Äúexquisitely stupid‚Äù movie. I would have enjoyed this more if Jordan Peele‚Äôs name wasn‚Äôt attached ‚Äî and thereby setting expectations ‚Äî but I still wouldn‚Äôt have loved it. That doesn‚Äôt make it a bad movie at all. It just means it isn‚Äôt what I look for in movies I am glad to see more action horror movies with black leads. I am glad this has a unique take on the thing's design. I am glad that Jordan Peele is making movies that people like, and I‚Äôm glad that you like it *** SPOILERS / Stray Thoughts *** The moment OJ seemed to know everything about the alien ‚Äî and predators in general ‚Äî I mentally checked out. The dialogue stopped making sense to me ‚Äî ‚Äúbreaking‚Äù the alien like a horse? It‚Äôs all a mudslide of bullshit to get to the final spectacle The Fry‚Äôs guy talks about them saving the planet‚Ä¶ by catching it on camera? Of course, they accidentally kill the alien, so they do save the world, but never once do they act under any other motivation than making money

Name: The Wolf House
Review:
The framing story is that a German colony within Chile is trying to clear up misunderstandings about them, and the story told is to help that

The colony punishes a girl named Maria, so she runs off into the woods. Trying to escape a wolf, she finds and enters a house. The story is about her exploration of the space and its metamorphosis (and hers) throughout the film between two-dimensional drawings on the wall, papier-m√¢ch√©, and real objects

It has a fairy tale essence with dark surrealism governing the world. Surreptitiously, the story functions as propaganda for the colony as Maria begins to regret leaving the colony after facing the consequences of staying in the house¬†

Beautiful animation ‚Äî it reminds me of William Kentridge with the sort of ‚Äúerased‚Äù trail of the movement

If you don‚Äôt know about Colonia Dignidad, look it up. Real fucked up stuff!

And at 75 minutes, how could you say no?

Name: Poison for the Fairies
Review:
Veronica is a poor orphan raised by her grandmother and her nanny. The nanny fills Veronica‚Äôs head with stories about witches, which excites Veronica‚Äôs curiosity

Flavia is a new student, and Veronica befriends her. Veronica uses happenstance and overhearing bits of gossip to convince Flavia that she is a witch

Their friendship sours as Veronica demands more from Flavia, holding her to secrets with threats. Still, the two seem to make amends. That is until they finally go through with a spell to make poison for the fairies, who are the natural enemies of witches

The movie takes a child‚Äôs perspective throughout, where almost all of the adults‚Äô faces are obscured or hidden until they serve to scare the children

This movie is a bit of a slow burn, but damn, what an ending!

Stray Thoughts
* Opening credits of the girl aging and turning into a witch ‚Äî amazing
* The human foley work for the frog noises is perfect. One jumps, and the old man doing the voice work says, ‚ÄúUgh.‚Äù
* Veronica picking up spiders and frogs is braver than the troops
* I feel like if a parent saw this movie, they‚Äôd never let their kids outside again¬†
* I knew a girl like Veronica briefly. In 2nd grade, she would boss me and this other boy around, holding us to promises of buying her expensive things in exchange for sex ‚Äî you know, usual 7-year-old stuff. Thankfully, she moved away before I did anything rash

Name: Yokai Monsters: Spook Warfare
Review:
Kaiju hellraiser? Some dummies dig for treasure where you aren‚Äôt supposed to and wake up a demon vampire thing. Hijinks ensue, and a water imp is awakened and fights the demon thing. He fails, cut to, like, 100 good demons coming out and partying

Definitely a kids' movie ‚Äî despite the blood and cursing ‚Äî but all the monster costumes ruled

Name: Faust
Review: From the moment the horsemen appeared, my jaw was agape. How does this movie look so good? The lighting is perfect, the makeup and costuming are excellent, and the cinematography is perfect ‚Äî the last time I felt like this while watching a silent film was watching Nosferatu ‚Äî no surprise, same director The second half does take a considerably slower pace, but the slow build of tension helps anchor the story and pull it out of ‚Äúboo hoo, a boy who got everything he wanted still not satisfied‚Äù into ‚Äúgetting what you want costs more than you know.‚Äù All ancient parable bullshit, rendered beautifully Stray Thoughts * It also helps that I don‚Äôt know the Faust story, so I didn‚Äôt have any story beats to anticipate or what changed in this adaptation * I‚Äôve watched Supernatural. I know what happens at crossroads * I didn‚Äôt realize Fantasia ripped off so much from this for the Night on Bald Mountain section * ‚ÄúWe still live, we still love, we shall die dancing in each other‚Äôs arms‚Äù ‚Äî this would be a good song lyric * The vial Faust carried around looks like a vape * Oh, queer-coded villains are as old as story, huh?

Name: Shoah
Review: ‚ÄúNo one can describe it. No one can recreate what happened here.‚Äù
Tags: torrent, 1001 movies, sight and sound, criterion

Name: The Beguiled
Review:
A preteen girl finds a wounded Union soldier (Clint Eastwood) and brings him to the Confederate boarding school she belongs to. Eastwood tries out his rizz on everyone he can ‚Äî including the younger girls ‚Äî stirring their repressed desires and their fears of a Union soldier who may hurt them. And yet, when the Confederate patrol passes by, the women opt to keep his presence a secret

Several women harbor secret feelings for Eastwood, each trying to vie for his attention and receive it. As Eastwood lies his way into their hearts, he plays fast and loose and lets one girl see him kiss another. From there, the tensions brew until Eastwood reveals himself for who he is

The film deals with how repression can only work as a coping mechanism for so long, that such secrecy can distort the world around you and prevent you from seeing who will care for you and who is exploiting your wound

I like Eastwood as a villain. I Ike how dark and unhinged this movie gets. I knew a little about it ‚Äî I‚Äôd seen Eastwood kissing a 12-year-old discussed out of context, and it‚Äôs worse in context

A fun and disturbing potboiler with a great ending
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, written by women

Name: Tenet
Review: I went in knowing I probably won‚Äôt love this movie. I wanted to see if I could enjoy the ‚Äúvibes‚Äù as they say The plot is totally irrelevant, but it also isn‚Äôt as hard to follow as people make it out to be. I‚Äôm not saying it‚Äôs logically cohesive, but like Inception, it layers in just enough bullshit ‚Äî okay, way too much bullshit‚Äî to follow along John David Washington is unbelievably bad in this. He makes this a worse movie by being too flat in his performance and not selling the choreography for the fight scenes. Thankfully there are masks to hide some of his work, aka give it to a stunt person to perform Robert Pattinson sells the concept much more effectively. He has the action movie swagger to make the stupidest stuff sound‚Ä¶ OK, and never to appear like he‚Äôs too committed to the insanity around him Overall, I didn‚Äôt love it, but I had fun eventually. Of course, it doesn‚Äôt make sense. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt try to understand it. Feel it‚Äù *** SPOILERS *** The movie becomes enjoyable in the last hour when we get to fold over what we‚Äôve seen and essentially watch the protagonist sabotage his efforts. Yes, it ties itself up into knots, but by having a real objective for the protagonist, it‚Äôs an easier ride

Name: The Mutilator
Review: Ed Jr is cleaning his dad‚Äôs guns for his dad‚Äôs birthday and accidentally shoots his mom in the back ‚Äî the way he looked down the barrel, I was hoping it would be him. The dad comes home and chases his son off with one of the guns and proceeds to take the body into his den and have a drink with it Cut to the kid as an adult, mocking his alcoholic father with his friends, revealing his dad asked him to clean a condo at the beach. Little do they know that Dad is still there, lying in wait to kill them for some reason (I guess because they‚Äôre having sex since the movie cannot stop talking about Pam being a virgin) Totally unoriginal on paper, and none of the plot matters, but as someone who has rented a beach house at Atlantic Beach, it hits closer to home than most slashers. And the gore is surprisingly well done ‚Äî Sue and the hook is an all-timer for brutal kills, yeesh! Overall, very funny Stray Thoughts * The most ominous version of ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù in a minor key, so funny * The NC accents are so brutal. It reminds me of home * His dad has a picture of a guy he accidentally killed with a motorboat. The image is posed like a fishing trophy? * The soundtrack for when the killer is about is pretty good. The synths sound crunchy and aggressive * Slowest undressing scene when they go skinny dipping in the pool * Ed Jr tied up is the most realistically whiney I‚Äôve seen someone¬† * (Sobbing) ‚ÄúJesus Christ, that‚Äôs my dad.‚Äù * We even get a couple of bloops at the end, hell yeah
Tags: joe bob, slasher, frightfest guide to exploitation movies

Name: Miami Vice
Review:
Now, THIS is a VIBE. Sexy people in Michael Mann lighting being shot with a flip phone or something

I‚Äôm convinced the resurgence of the mullet and mustache is due to Colin Ferrell in this movie

Does Justin Thoreaux have more than 1-2 lines? He‚Äôs just, like, hanging out. I love it

This is plotted like an episode of tv in the middle of the second season ‚Äî it gives no shits about you knowing anyone or anything

Sex to Audioslave is funny. This whole soundtrack is so doofy

Name: Double Indemnity
Review: A boring insurance salesman (Frederick MacMurray) opts in on helping a hot housewife (Barbara Stanwyck) kill her husband and commit insurance fraud because he‚Äôs too horny to say no In telling his story through flashback, bleeding into an audio recording, we know he loses out on everything. But the fun is in seeing the plan play out and the wrinkles develop It‚Äôs hard to fully appreciate just because it‚Äôs so influential and well-known, but the Raymond Chandler dialogue is snappy, the lighting is beautiful, and Stanwyck is a great femme fatale Stray Thoughts * Keys talks like Larry David as Mr. Steinbrenner in Seinfeld * Seeing Body Heat first was a mistake. It‚Äôs essentially the same movie ‚Äî Body Heat has a better ending

Name: Heat
Review: Two fifty-something men who should‚Äôve given up the game ages ago become entangled in each other‚Äôs lives, forcing everyone they care about out of the way, risking it all for that last score because neither knows how to stop De Niro falls closer in line with Mann‚Äôs outsider ‚Äî much of his demeanor reminds me of Vincent in Collateral, someone whose mantra is ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt let yourself get attached to anything you‚Äôre not willing to walk out on in 30 seconds flat if you feel the heat around the corner.‚Äù This mentality doesn‚Äôt stop him from trying when Amy Brenneman comes into his life, but when scores he needs to settle scores, he can‚Äôt just let himself walk away Pacino is still a Mann character ‚Äî closer in spirit to Will Graham in Manhunter than Frank in Thief ‚Äî whose on the tail end of his third marriage because the work will always come first. It‚Äôs an easy lie for him to swallow that he keeps his work separate from home because of its gristly nature, but his wife ‚Äî Diane Venora ‚Äî isn‚Äôt able to live off scraps alone Their worlds are full of miserable people who are trying to figure out how to live ‚Äî anyone who stands too close to them gets bigger targets on their backs, and many of them end up dead Mann forces the audience to live with the consequences of these characters‚Äô choices, removing any veneer of cool, heroism, or happily ever after. More importantly, he is at his best when his main characters have to confront their reality and the wake of their destructive ways That doesn‚Äôt mean you don‚Äôt get the stellar action set pieces ‚Äî the shootouts, the car chases, the running through hotels and airports ‚Äî all shot with tense close-ups, beautiful bokeh, and crunching guitars It‚Äôs the combination of all these things that justify its nearly 3-hour runtime. An all-timer action flick that transcends the genre and teaches copycats all the wrong lessons
Tags: netflix, 1001 movies, sight and sound, heist

Name: Blacker Than the Night
Review:
Four women in various states of undress live in a house together. One of the women learns that she inherits the house and a substantial sum from her recently deceased aunt, with the condition that she cares for her cat Bequer¬†

The women are less than thrilled about the cat ‚Äî described as blacker than the night (hey that‚Äôs the name of the movie!) ‚Äî but the opportunity is too valuable to ignore, especially when rent and space is a major consideration

While living there, they hear a voice in the garden calling for Bequer, but they can‚Äôt figure out who it is. Eventually, the women find Bequer dead, supposedly locked in the cellar and starved

Soon after the death, the women start dying one after another, each seeing the dead aunt just before something happens to her

It‚Äôs pretty tame and predictable but the cinematography is pretty great, especially when it goes psychedelic

Name: Battleship Potemkin
Review:
A group of sailors stands in solidarity to mutiny against the unlivable conditions of their ship, refusing the maggot-filled food. The non-rebelling soldiers kill the leader, and the mutiny is quelled

The death stirs the ire of the people in Odessa, hundreds of who stand in line and gather around the dead sailor‚Äôs body. The death inspires the people to fight against tyranny, rending their garments and taking to the seas

On the Odessa stairs, people charge down, soldiers shooting after them. In the madness, the people stomp on a kid. Also, the soldiers shoot a new mother, and her baby carriage falls down the stairs

The final boat sequence, where they raise the flags to encourage the attacking enemy ship to join them is stressful!

Great compositions and editing for the time ‚Äî it feels fast-paced and intense. The action shots where they throw a guy into the water and cuts to several different angles in rapid succession, to where we see one fall happen several times to build the intensity ‚Äî that technique is still in action movies ‚Äî it‚Äôs almost a cliche for how often it‚Äôs used in explosions to get the full effect

Hard to overstate how important this is and how watchable it still is. Glad I revisited this now ‚Äî I feel like I didn‚Äôt know how to appreciate it when I watched it in college

Stay Thoughts
* The priest looks like Moses on Mt Sinai
* The water in the fog looks so good ‚Äî it‚Äôs hypnotic
Tags: torrent, karagarga, sight and sound, 1001 movies

Name: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
Review: People are reporting that someone they love is not the person anymore. The person has all of the memories, the vocabulary, the appearance, but lacks the emotional qualities that those close to the loved one can recognize It‚Äôs no surprise that the psychiatrist ‚Äî Kevin McCarthy ‚Äî thinks something is wrong with the person reporting the changes in their loved one and not the loved one themselves ‚Äî mass hysteria. But when it happens to more and more people, the veneer of certainty slips Things grow more dire as a friend shows the psychiatrist a dead body that looks like an incomplete person with no fingerprints ‚Äî a body that has more than a passing resemblance to the friend. When the body disappears, and more friends change, the psychiatrist and his girlfriend ‚Äî Dana Wynter ‚Äî must go on the run Don Siegel makes low-budget feel larger than life, telling a story of conformity and apathy by taking over people‚Äôs bodies. The remake is the more lover of the films, at least by sci-fi/horror fans, but this is a foundational entry in genre movie history Stray Thoughts * ‚ÄúOpen your mouth, close your eyes, and I‚Äôll give you something to make you wise‚Äù ‚Äî I‚Äôve never heard ‚Äúsomething about o make you wise,‚Äù I grew up with ‚Äúa big surprise.‚Äù I guess the former is appropriate when the gift is medicine * The pod people hatching is so foamy and gross * The classic ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre coming for you!‚Äù yelled directly into the camera

Name: Zero for Conduct
Review:
Kid rebellion in a boarding school, aided in part by Supervisor Huguet (Jean Dast√©), expressed in rioting, trashing classrooms and bedrooms, and several feats of magic ‚Äî the world made in the kids‚Äô vision

I‚Äôve never seen anything like this, it never broadcasts when it‚Äôs going to do surreal stuff, it just jumps out of kids playing to impossibilities

It‚Äôs so funny that the French Ministry of the Interior considered portraying rebellious kids onscreen as a threat to the maintenance of order

Kind of chaotic and difficult to follow at points, but still an amazing experience

Name: The Last Little Red Riding Hood
Review:
A grandmother with mangled legs trying to capture red riding hood for her legs so she can dance again ‚Äî a wolf man who wants red riding hood to fall in love with him, and will make her ‚Äî a wild backstory about red hoods being summoned from inside the earth by bombs

On paper, an interesting idea. In practice, some okay songs and decent dancing, but too mired by the concept. Also, incredibly gory in the scene where a monster destroys the grandmother‚Äôs legs

Looks cool in that 90s music video sort of way

Name: Shin Kamen Rider
Review:
I don‚Äôt know what to say, this was a bad movie. I can‚Äôt think of one thing it did well

Nothing felt like it had stakes, no character had more than a single-line description that summed up their entire personality, the pacing was a slog because no clear objectives  were ever set, and the costumes looked so cheap

If nothing else, they should‚Äôve focused on the fights, but every single one was so anime-core that they stood and talked, the camera blurred for a few minutes, and then the fight was over. No choreography, just quick cuts, and if you did see the fight it was CGI

I think people are gaslighting themselves into liking this because Hideaki Anno wrote and directed it, but if he put any amount of care into this, it wouldn‚Äôt look and feel so hacked together

Perhaps it was too beholden to the 70s TV show, and if I had seen the show I would like it more. Maybe I‚Äôm in the wrong state of mind to appreciate what it‚Äôs doing. But in the end I had a bad time

Name: The Daytrippers
Review:
Eliza (Hope Davis) finds a love note she didn‚Äôt write that may be directed to her husband Louis (Stanley Tucci), so she goes into the city with her family ‚Äî her sister Jo (Parker Posey), Jo‚Äôs boyfriend Carl (Liev Schreiber), and her mother and father (Anna Meara and Pat McNamara) ‚Äî to investigate

Greg Mottola‚Äôs strength has shown to be hangout comedies with real people and stories, and this movie is no exception. The characters are messy, and while the story has a predictable arc, the people who inhabit the film make the experience a memorable one

I don‚Äôt think they handle the reveal well, but for a 90s movie, it could be much worse. Still, a memorable entry in the ‚Äúholiday movies you might not watch with your family.‚Äù

Stray Thoughts:
* Is Stanley Tucci just Jason Schwartzmann without the hair?
* The mom is so funny ‚Äî ‚ÄúCarl, you‚Äôre a smart man. What is this? I don‚Äôt understand poetry.‚Äù
* Low budget, filming in the car with closeups by necessity, putting everyone‚Äôs thought processes in different frames ‚Äî people talk, and no one listens ‚Äî makes the movie feel cozy
* The wavering focus of the camera moving through the party is so effective¬†
* Woo, good ending!

Name: Wound
Review:
Micro-budget horror movies tend to gain attention by making up the budget with extreme violence or fucked up subject matter ‚Äî this isn‚Äôt the first I‚Äôve seen with a castration scene

The movie attempts to enter a headspace similar to Lynch or Jodorowsky, where dream and reality merge, and answers are left up to the viewer. One crucial piece this lacks that Lynch‚Äôs work contains is empathy for the suffering individuals portrayed. It feels like the extreme imagery predominantly comes from a ‚Äúwouldn‚Äôt this be fucked up?‚Äù approach

That isn‚Äôt to say that the film is unmotivated. At the core is a wound left by a mother abandoning their child, and in a mirror, the loss of a child during childbirth ‚Äî mother and child pass DNA to one another, and both are bound to one another ‚Äî where one ends, the other begins

One of the better-explored ideas is Susan‚Äôs (Kate O‚ÄôRourke) perceived constant watch by surveillance cameras, both hidden in every room in her house and present during every human encounter

Overall, I don‚Äôt think all of the psychosexual imagery works in this movie, but it definitely has ideas, and I‚Äôll probably be thinking about it for a bit

Name: Sans Soleil
Review:
A travelogue narrated by one who received the stories, philosophical musings, and meta-commentary on the nature of documentary from the traveler, collected in writing, bits of recounting, and the footage to match it, often in a more abstract sense

Combined to achieve a poetic tone rather than to tell a cohesive narrative, mixing the spectacle of parades and festivals with the mundanity of people standing idly, of stock footage of space launches and bomb drops, of footage on tv screens

The film is about the fetishization of memory and how images become stand-ins for it, about how culture is the manifestation of the insecurity of self and the inaccessibility of history, and about how video games and movie clips occupy our dreams

Could‚Äôve been 20-30 minutes shorter and still accomplished all this, but beautiful all the same
Tags: criterion channel, criterion, sight and sound, 1001 movies, Psychogeography

Name: Junkopia
Review: Tarkovsky noise scape over some outsider art installations ‚Äî could be B footage in something, but on its own, pretty trivial

Name: Dr. Caligari
Review:
‚ÄúYour wife has a disease of the libido‚Äù

Dr. Caligari performs weird sexual experiments on mental patients. It doesn‚Äôt go well

It‚Äôs one of those things you might show to a friend to make them go ‚ÄúWhat the hell?‚Äù But it‚Äôs faux camp ‚Äî trying to create disgust and surrealism but doesn‚Äôt arrive anywhere beyond its odd erotic imagery. The characters speak abstract referential dialogue to signify their ‚Äúdisturbed‚Äù mind, rarely saying anything to one another

Worst of all, it‚Äôs just boring ‚Äî there‚Äôs no indicator of where it wants to go, so you just let it unfold for 90 tedious minutes

Neat visuals, though, gross and cartoony, sort of like Nickelodeon‚Äôs take on Hellraiser. If only it were enjoyable to watch

Name: Twister
Review: Watching this for a podcast Storm chasers with trauma ‚Äî Phillip Seymour Hoffman is a perfectly insufferable dude-bro, Cary Elwes is a slimy dick, Alan Ruck and Jeremy Davis are‚Ä¶ there. This brand of 90s movie is comfort food to a bunch of folks, it‚Äôs incredibly easy to watch I haven‚Äôt seen this since I was a kid and I remember these special effects feeling so real and scary. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôve drunkenly argued that they still look good, despite not seeing it in years. Egg on my face! Bill Paxton makes no sense as the lead, and the lesson seems to have been learned because I can‚Äôt recall any other mainstream movies where he is. Keep him in the sci-fi/horror world where he can be a goddamn weirdo One of the best dumb climaxes I can remember ‚Äî tankers exploding, rivals driving directly into a tornado, and of course the belt and the iconic pipe scene If I remember correctly, the screenshots of Dorothy collecting data were actually from the simulation software they used for the tornado effects I‚Äôll be honest, I was dreading this, but I had a good time, especially in the end when it went full gonzo ‚Äî this is the sort of dumb fun that Sharknado wished it could replicate Five acts, five tornados, five times the fun! I put that in just in case someone comes to me for a pull quote about the movie

Name: Possession
Review: I never noticed until this time around that Helen describes the alien race (or whatever they are)

Name: The Howling
Review: Seems Joe Dante‚Äôs thing is shoestring plotting to showcase cool special effects. The transformation looks cool but boy does it take a while

Name: Onibaba
Review:
During a war that has recruited the men, a woman and her daughter-in-law live in the tall grass, murdering passing samurai and selling their wares for whatever they can get. They dispose of the bodies in a dark pit

Hachi, a friend of the daughter‚Äôs husband, returns from the war to tell them that the husband is dead. Soon, the daughter-in-law begins to sneak out at night to sleep with Hachi, worrying the woman that the daughter will leave and she won‚Äôt be able to survive on her own

One night while the daughter has snuck out, a samurai with a demon mask forces his way into their house, looking for a guide through the tall grass. She guides him to the dark pit and lets him fall, stealing his mask and sealing her fate

The blades of grass in the wind, the sharp contrasts ‚Äî such a beautifully shot film. Also. I love the small scope of the movie ‚Äî it keeps its focus and tension contained
Tags: criterion channel, 1001 movies, folk horror: a study, criterion, kaidan

Name: Lucky
Review: A man in a mask is outside. ‚ÄúHoney, that‚Äôs the man who comes every night to kill us,‚Äù says the husband. May is understandably perplexed Everyone keeps telling her she‚Äôs lucky to be alive, but don‚Äôt treat her like she‚Äôs in danger. May feels like she has to go it alone. Everyone gives advice that feels more like relationship advice than how to handle a stalker ‚ÄúThis is just the way things are now,‚Äù the movie refrains Ultimately, the movie becomes both too overt and too abstract about what it‚Äôs trying to say. It has some ideas I like, and I think it manages to hold it together until the 3rd act. Still, I was engaged the whole time ***Spoilers*** * It has the same ending as Men

Name: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
Review:
Following up Into the Spider-Verse is a difficult task, considering it‚Äôs probably the most beloved Marvel movie they didn‚Äôt make. They certainly made it bigger ‚Äî more references, more multiverse Spider-Men in different art styles, more movies

I loved the movie‚Äôs first act in Spider Gwen‚Äôs universe ‚Äî the art style is so expressive, and the colors are so beautiful. Beyond that, I felt the movie get longer in parts than necessary and that nearly every set piece overstayed its welcome. They‚Äôre all good, it's just too much of it, especially when there‚Äôs a whole other movie of content coming next year

Overall, it‚Äôs still among the best comic book movies, it‚Äôs just that that bar is growing lower with each passing year

Name: Meshes of the Afternoon
Review: Guess I have to be in love with Maya Deren now

Name: Female Prisoner Scorpion: #701
Review:
Two women attempt a breakout from a prison in broad daylight. For the attempt, the inmates all suffer the abuses of the prison guards

Flashback to a woman in love who does a sting operation for him and gets caught ‚Äî first by the target, then by her lover who has set her up. She tries to kill him, but the police pull her off and arrest her

The movie becomes about her survival and her planning to escape and get revenge

Great use of color to heighten emotional moments. The camera is manic, zooming, spinning, and bending around the scenes ‚Äî a glass fight in the communal shower grows surreal as the room glows blue, the woman‚Äôs face contorts, and her hair flies up to convey the malice

It‚Äôs still a women-in-prison exploitation movie ‚Äî tons of nudity, violence, and lesbian sex ‚Äî but that doesn‚Äôt limit its ambitions
Tags: shudder, pinku, sexploitation, Women in Prison

Name: House
Review: Soul Man director Steve Minor gives us a story about a house‚Ä¶ that hates. A newly separated writer moves into his old family home ‚Äî the one at which his son went missing ‚Äî and the house is not having it. The ghost of his aunt shows up to tell him that the house won, that it tricked her One of those great posters/VHS covers I‚Äôd see at Blockbuster, but I would never rent it The movie is like cartoony family-friendly horror about PTSD. He‚Äôs trying to write a book about his time in Vietnam while dealing with a haunted house, and the movie has to make it all fit together, and it doesn‚Äôt make sense Monster/ghost effects look pretty alright ‚Äî the matted painting of the house on the cliff near the end looks cool. If the movie went broader and more over-the-top with the humor or the gore or the scares, it might be something good. But it does everything so safe and by the book Stray Thoughts * Dali painting on the wall. The kid walks in and sees it. ‚ÄúSick,‚Äù he says dismissively * Norm! He has all the best lines * The dude cannot wrap his mind around the ghost disappearing in the house. Every time it surprises and confuses him * He wanted proof that the thing existed. But when he killed it, he cut it up and buried it instead * His Vietnam flashbacks are so goofy ‚Äî why would he write a book about any of them?

Name: Day of Wrath
Review: An older woman in a village stands accused of witchcraft. To the priest who tortures her for her confession, she begs him to spare her as he had the mother of his wife ‚Äî a much younger woman than he ‚Äî who was also accused of witchcraft. He denies her pleas, and the men cast her into the fire The priest‚Äôs son from a prior marriage comes to live with them. The son and the priest‚Äôs wife fall in love with each other, the wife wishing her older husband would die so that they could be together The visual storytelling is so sharp ‚Äî Dreyer‚Äôs expertise as a silent film director translates well, and the lines of dialogue are meaningful accents and surface-level details. Some scenes look like classical paintings the way they are composed Dreyer is the king of the closeup if Joan of Arc didn‚Äôt tell you. Empathy and beauty, eyes aglow, pain rendered real and terrible Much of it feels like stage work, and I know some people think that is a weakness or vestigial part of the transition from stage to screen, but there‚Äôs a lot of power in composing a set this way This is a perfect movie. Every moment is so carefully and attentively rendered Stray Thoughts * I love the illuminated text opening scroll * The boy‚Äôs choir functions like the Greek chorus * The older woman accused of being a witch is so fucking good ‚Äî I love every second of her performance * The confession torture scene is such a contrast to the usual high-intensity scenes in other films. You see the resignation and guilt the men feel as they put this woman who could be their mother ‚Äî someone they know in the community ‚Äî through this * The scene of the older woman being thrown into the fire looks so real!
Tags: torrent, karagarga, criterion, claire denis req

Name: Daisies
Review: Sister rebellion ‚Äî hair in pigtails, ring of flowers on her head ‚Äî cake before dinner followed by soup ‚Äî no longer watching my figure  ‚Äî stealing drinks, climbing on furniture ‚Äî open jar of pickles next to the phone ‚Äî send men off on trains ‚Äî cut a pickle in half, a sausage and banana into pieces as he pleads for her affection ‚Äî nihilistic decadence set to a kaleidoscope of color and manic editing techniques

Name: Polyester
Review: God I‚Äôll never get over Baltimore accents, they‚Äôre so good. Did John Waters invent smell-o-vision? Quotes that made me laugh (that I remembered to write down) * ‚ÄúThis whole world stinks so get used to it!‚Äù * ‚Äú1-3-5-9, G-rated movies are totally fine‚Äù * ‚ÄúOh Francine, there might be a god, everything is so beautiful!‚Äù * "Gee, Francine! You're the most drinkin'est gal I know!" * ‚ÄúLet me kiss away your DTs honey‚Äù

Name: A History of Violence
Review: Rewatching for a podcast¬† The guy who fucks his wife also shoots some bad fellas. The TV calls him a hero. Ed Harris and his friends recognize him, and the guy who fucks becomes the guy who doesn‚Äôt fuck around I guess Cronenberg wanted to make his Blue Velvet ‚Äî dark heart of suburban America, coffee and pie, the stories we tell ourselves to get through Didn‚Äôt love it, but I see why people like it

Name: Totally F***ed Up
Review: MORE TEEN ANGST ‚Äî Joy Division, The Cure, The Smiths ‚Äî AIDS is government-sponsored genocide ‚Äî Everybody thinks I‚Äôm high and I am ‚Äî Mutual terror of loneliness  ‚Äî Love lasts as long as a squirt in the dark ‚Äî I know, I know, never trust a fire sign ‚Äî Can this world really be as sad as it seems? ‚Äî My poor little fucking heart got broken, BFD ‚Äî Feels like god in heaven‚Äôs gone insane

Name: The Girl Next Door
Review:
f you read the synopsis of this movie, it sounds like a grindhouse flick, but the movie‚Äôs tone is closer to a Lifetime movie. I mean, there are some upsetting scenes, but it‚Äôs not dwelled on in an exploitation way, but more trying to communicate what is happening. Still, what happens is genuinely disturbing

The thin line between the morbid fascinations of children ‚Äî killing bugs, pulling apart worms, stomping on frogs (I didn‚Äôt do the last one, but I knew a kid who did) ‚Äî and the harming of others seems only held together by the caregiver or teacher who helps establish that boundary and punishes its transgression. Add to that the human fascination with freak shows and the dehumanization that comes with it, and we see that the events of this story are more likely than we‚Äôd like to admit

If you want to look at the dark heart of American suburbia, this film does it
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, torture porn

Name: Sanctuary
Review:
Ultra-rich guy (Christopher Abbot), who has a regularly scheduled dominatrix (Margaret Qualley), decides to call things off with her after he learns that he‚Äôll be CEO of his now-deceased father‚Äôs company. But she isn‚Äôt ready to end things and won‚Äôt leave without a fight

Pretty fun movie, a little slow, with a lot of scenery chewing, especially from Margaret Qualley, and a couple of chuckles here and there. I enjoyed the directions it took ‚Äî I probably wouldn‚Äôt watch it again, but I‚Äôm glad that I did

Name: The Doom Generation
Review:
‚ÄúEver feel like reality is more twisted than dreams?‚Äù

Two industrial goth kids run into the most chaotic bisexual, and the world turns hostile on them at every motel and convenience store. On the run, killing and shacking up, their fate is sealed in anti-queer America as they try to figure out what they want and what it all means.

So funny! Everyone is so hot in this ‚Äî Jonathon Schaech could have chemistry with a Doritos bag ‚Äî and extremely violent in places.

James Duval in a Ministry tee shirt. Parker Posey in heart sunglasses wielding a katana. If that doesn‚Äôt sell you, then I don‚Äôt want to know you.

In some ways, I hate how it ends, but it also ‚Äî relatively speaking ‚Äî makes the most sense. I also like how open-ended some of the plot points end up being. There‚Äôs room for several interpretations, as well as none ‚Äî it‚Äôs all oblivion.

So glad that Criterion Channel has the new uncut version of the movie! I don‚Äôt know how I‚Äôd feel about it if I saw the R-rated cut. As it stands, probably my favorite road movie, at least for the moment.

Name: Killer Nun
Review:
A nun receives brain surgery to remove a tumor ‚Äî ‚Äúcut away the evil,‚Äù as her mother says ‚Äî and her life grows irreparably dark and painful ‚Äî headaches, blackouts, and she can‚Äôt control her anger. Only heroin helps the pain, but she gets lost in a haze. Soon, murders happen all around her, and all the clues point to her

The movie has a couple of wild moments ‚Äî and one cringe-inducing face torture scene ‚Äî but the film gets convoluted in its plot points before one big reveal, leaving everything else where it is

Not a bad movie, just not one I‚Äôd go out of my way to recommend. If you‚Äôre looking for wild nunsploitation, you have better options
Tags: tubi, house of psychotic women, video nasties, giallo, nunsploitation, sexploitation, Slasher

Name: Blue
Review:
A blue screen sets the stage for a surreal audio exploration of the director‚Äôs experience with dying of AIDS. Stories range from the mythical to the all-too-real, all themed around the color blue, beautifully rendered in a soundscape of Buddhist chimes, Greek choruses, and ambiance

A film with more layers than I could parse the first time through. It will require repeat listens ‚Äî maybe not too soon ‚Äî it‚Äôs a rough experience

Name: Enemy
Review: Jake Gyllenhaal is a man trying to play two roles ‚Äî the man who is married and the man who is having an affair. He is trying to figure out which one is the life that he wants. In the undeciphered chaos of his mind, he knows that one will overtake the other, but he is afraid of what is lost. But even when he thinks he‚Äôs made up his mind, the cycle begins again, and he has become hostage to something that he doesn‚Äôt understand about himself This movie is the same color as NYC skies right now ‚Äî a jaundiced yellow that puts Soderbergh‚Äôs shite color grading to shame This movie is pretty funny in an uncanny sort of way ‚Äî I feel like the filmmaking doesn‚Äôt let you know you‚Äôre allowed (supposed?) to laugh. Like Gyllenhaal says some ridiculous things I wonder how much of the book has all of these elements. Regardless, the film feels like a fully realized concept, with just enough at the edge to keep you thinking ***Spoilers*** The tarantula is subconscious desire ‚Äî a thing that can feel small and kept under your heel like a dictator or a sudden monster whom you may not realize has overpowered you At least, that‚Äôs my theory! It could also just be a scary thing to have in a movie ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

Name: L'√Çge d'or
Review:
The church won‚Äôt let them fuck, so they shit and kiss and suck on statues and throw shit out windows. In the end, Jesus emerges from the orgy castle from 120 Says of Sodom

It‚Äôs fine ‚Äî I mostly like how many people it pissed off

Fuck Salvador Dal√≠! He tried to get Bu√±uel to tone this down so it wouldn‚Äôt upset Dal√≠‚Äôs fascist friends. Bu√±uel made it without Dal√≠, and then Dal√≠ decried the movie as propaganda against the Catholic Church, inspiring anti-Jewish groups to riot at screenings

Name: The Entity
Review:
A woman with a son and two daughters begins to experience brutal beatings and rapes from an unknown, unseen entity. Her son sees it, and in trying to protect her, the thing breaks his arm

Her close friend tells her to see a psychiatrist, who is convinced it is hysteria, contagious to the children, and living in her house. She comes in with bruises and bite marks, but he explained them away away

Though the movie goes towards a paranormal explanation for what occurs, the patterns onscreen mirror domestic abuse in horrifying ways. Days will pass when she feels in control and unafraid. Then, without notice, it will start up again. Slowly, she resigns herself to the experience, and it never really stops

The soundtrack is industrial and frightening, maybe one of the more effective 80s horror soundtracks I‚Äôve heard

From a filmmaking perspective, I think the story arc is uneven and takes an odd turn toward the end. I suppose because it‚Äôs ‚Äúbased on a true account,‚Äù it wanted to follow that account as closely as possible while still making a spectacle

I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a hidden classic, but I do think it is underrated and worth seeing because, despite its adjacency to familiar horror movie territory, its meta text is on another level
Tags: torrent, house of psychotic women, haunted house, frightfest guide to ghost movies

Name: Drunken Angel
Review:
A drunk doctor treats TB patients in post-war Japan, and his most recent patient is a yakuza member who must give up his lifestyle to receive treatment. The two become close, but tensions rise when another yakuza is released from prison and drags the patient back into the life

Sentimental, surreptitiously critical of US occupation, and two standout performances from Takeshi Shimura and Toshir≈ç Mifune, this being the latter‚Äôs first of sixteen films made with Kurosawa

There‚Äôs a dream sequence of breaking open a coffin on the beach and seeing himself chased by himself ‚Äî pretty surreal for an otherwise grounded film

I want to watch more of Kurosawa‚Äôs gangster stuff ‚Äî I‚Äôll probably check out Stray Dog soon

Name: Teenagers from Outer Space
Review:
The lobster being held in front of the camera to look like a giant monster is an all-timer ‚Äî just incredible¬†

‚ÄúGood night, sweet crustacean‚Äù

Name: Sisters
Review: A 2006 remake of De Palma‚Äôs Sisters because ‚Äúeveryone else is doing Hitchcock remakes, why not do a Hitchcock knock-off remake?‚Äù Thankfully, unlike, say, Van Sant‚Äôs Psycho remake, this tries to approach the story from a new angle, looking for an empathetic treatment of the sisters as well as a more coherent way to arrive at the climax (including a belabored relationship to hidden cameras) The movie spends most of its time with the story beats from the first 20-30 minutes of the original, so the journey for Sevigny‚Äòs character takes a sharper turn, requiring a pile of flashbacks and onscreen text to justify itself Music queues are way over-the-top ‚Äî someone waking up to a jump scare sting? Just have zero confidence in the film Pretty rote, uninspired filmmaking otherwise Stray Thoughts: * Call from A!? What is this, Pretty Little Liars? * The most useless cops (redundant, I know) * The most unnecessary breast shot in a movie, literally a 2-second flashback of Sevigny in the bath

Name: Daddy's Deadly Darling
Review:
‚ÄúDad Rapes Daughter and Dies of Knife Wound,‚Äù reads the newspaper headline. Said daughter (Toni Lawrence, the director‚Äôs daughter) is put in a psych ward and given shock treatment, but when a nurse and doctor run off to fuck, she escapes¬†

An old farmer / former circus magician (Marc Lawrence, the director) steals bodies from the morgue to feed his pigs because that‚Äôs all they‚Äôll eat after accidentally feeding them a person. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs against the law to turn dead people into pigs,‚Äù says the sheriff

Toni shows up at the pig farm looking for work, and the farmer makes a place for her. But on a date when a guy won‚Äôt take ‚Äúno‚Äù for an answer, she slashes him up. The farmer finds out and helps dispose of the body. And so the cycle begins

The movie has very little pig presence, focusing more on Toni‚Äôs character, who regularly calls and talks to her daddy, even though we know he‚Äôs dead. She can‚Äôt accept her role and blocks out not only his murder but all of them

The two lead performances aren‚Äôt stellar, but they are thought-out and (slightly) less exploitative than the material suggests. And while the filmmaking is just okay, the story has just enough weird going on to make it work

One murder scene has the quickest edits I‚Äôve seen in a movie from this era, just an explosion of images. It‚Äôs not good or anything ‚Äî it‚Äôs just noteworthy
Tags: amazon prime, house of psychotic women, video nasties, nature attacks, hicksploitation

Name: Boy Meets Girl
Review: A woman brings a man home for a one-night stand, watches some porn, and sedates him. He wakes up tied to a dentist's chair. Why? I don‚Äôt know, really The writers are boys who are scared of women but aren‚Äôt sure why, creating a caricature of violence that hates men, but they can‚Äôt understand why anyone would, so they make her a serial killer with no discernible motivation Don‚Äôt get me wrong ‚Äî the guy sucks ‚Äî killing him isn‚Äôt the problem ‚Äî it‚Äôs the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù that I can‚Äôt figure out We spend most of the movie in one room, and you can see them trying to fill up time and find other ways of filming it, but it gets old so quickly Each scene has a multi-colored title card. The cards are pretty on the nose and don‚Äôt add anything other than a break from the room If the movie were any good, I‚Äôd think about it more, but the film is so tediously shot and poorly conceived or realized Stray Thoughts * The cigarette helmet is funny (it forces him to smoke three cigarettes at once, and the movie treats it so ominously) * Jar of penises? Sure, why not * Does he recognize slugs and maggots by taste? * ‚ÄúGod is dead. She died broken-hearted by her critics.‚Äù

Name: Martyrs
Review:
A grotesque vision of purity and proximity to the divine through suffering and whether one can survive the revelation it brings

Lucie tracks down and murders the people who kidnapped and tortured her as a child ‚Äî not for herself, but to appease the specter of another child she left behind in her escape

Anna gives herself over to Lucie‚Äôs delusions, tending to her and enabling her, but when Lucie is given her gift for doing what was asked of her, Anna must transfer that self-sacrifice elsewhere

Maybe the most realistically gory movie I‚Äôve seen. I‚Äôm sensitive to razors, so the frequent razor/box cutter violence was a lot. Believe me: it gets so much worse as it goes

It took getting to the end of the movie to determine whether I liked it or not ‚Äî all this? For what end? Ultimately, I do think it achieves something wholly of its own, for better or worse

Still, a part of me wishes I had not watched this

Name: Tampopo
Review:
Two truckers ride into town looking for ramen and meet Tampopo, who needs help perfecting her ramen recipe. The truckers take her under their wing, along with a few other ragtag dudes

I feel like if I wrote down everything said, I would be able to make ramen at home, but maybe the movie just made me believe in Tampopo‚Äôs ascension from amateur to true ramen chef

The horny interludes were off-putting at first, but as it went on, their comedic intent became clearer. That said, passing the egg yolk back and forth in their mouths was a lot to handle

I didn‚Äôt feel the magical love that others seem to feel for this, but I did enjoy it. Maybe it needs to be watched when I‚Äôm hungry and/or with friends?
Tags: criterion channel, criterion, 1001 movies, coming-of-age, good for her

Name: Night on Earth
Review:
Just what I needed ‚Äî chill Jarmuch vibes, great little vignettes, room to breathe in the dialogue to let the landscape melt into the scene

Wynona Rider and Gena Rowlands scene is fantastic, I love both of them
‚Äî ‚ÄúGuys, can‚Äôt live with em, can‚Äôt shoot ‚Äòem‚Äù
‚Äî ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry I sound calm, I assure you I am hysterical‚Äù

Young Giancarlo Esposito! I haven‚Äôt seen him this energetic and funny before. Armin Mueller-Stahl is an adorable, out-of-his-element German clown. No one delivers a ‚Äúfuck you‚Äù like Rosie Perez

Two French dudes ragging on Isaach De Bankol√© for being bad at driving ‚Äî blind because he‚Äôs Ivorian? Not a joke I‚Äôd understand ‚Äî but then he pics up Beatrice Dalle, whose character is blind but knows where he is on the road. It‚Äôs nice to see her in something that isn‚Äôt fucked up

Roberto Benigni being a goddamn weirdo, Paolo Bonacelli being cold and off-putting, no surprises there. This is the worst segment, Benigni is exhausting

I don‚Äôt know any Finnish actors offhand, but I guess all these dudes have been in award-winning Finnish movies ‚Äî neat! Big Eastern Bloc vibes. It's sad but well-conceived

Overall, nothing is outstanding, but everything is good (except for the Rome segment)

Name: The Loved Ones
Review:
Lola wants to take Brent to prom, but Brent has a girlfriend and declines. So, with the help of her doting and incestuous father, she captures him and tortures him

The film looks great ‚Äî the sets, the colors, the gnarly practical effects. The wordless third act is subtly introduced but effectively executed. The story and character, not so much¬†

Lola‚Äôs methods of torture and way of interacting with Brent once he‚Äôs in her grasps ranges from child not understanding the effect of violence to pervert with some specific kinks. Add to that the way she tries to seduce her father, and none of it really adds up to a person that seems real

Also, almost every other character is given the ‚Äúwife waiting at home for her husband to return from war‚Äù passivity that makes checking in on them tedious

There‚Äôs a B-plot with Brent‚Äôs friend Jamie that comes and goes with no real hiccups, and no interaction with the main plot line. It‚Äôs clear that the scenes are meant to provide some relief from all the intense torture and dour sadness, but I guess they couldn‚Äôt see a way to make it fit

Overall, it‚Äôs not a terrible movie, it just doesn‚Äôt provide anything substantial to give it any sort of staying power
